text: This place is not just a restaurant has a great bar and a outside deck with one of the best views of Las Vegas. The food is good and selections is limited. Drink are on the expensive side and it is a private club. I would recommend there steak with crab. It has a disco at night at 10 pm the space is small and can be crowded. I would recommend this place and I am going back again.

We have been members for several years and the place never disappoints us.  Great food, good drinks and a fantastic atmosphere.  Of course there's the view from the balcony as well.  We have taken dozens of people here and all of them have loved the place.  You can also arrange to have people on the guest list when you're not in town, a very nice perk.

Located on the top of Mandalay Bay, Foundation Room has an awesome view. It's kind of like the Mix Club that's located on top of The Hotel, but has a Buddha theme going on.   I went here for my cousins after party and thought it was cool, it wasn't crowded. But around 11:30, there were a lot of people. I only noticed two rooms which were not that big. The main room and the room that is located near the hallway.

This place saved our night and the view was amazing. It's not packed but that's the best part for us, we're not bumping into people and everyone there was super friendly. The drinks are cheap and strong, not the $21 water down vodka cran you find at most nightclubs. The music is top 40 hip hop and there's another dj that plays different music in the back. The hosts and the staff are also great. We will probably visit this place every time we come to Vegas.

I ate here Friday night this week.  We made a reservation. We were sat quickly, but it took some time to get water and drinks ordered.  That was the only complaint I had.  After that the service was great and the food was excellent. The Thai dish was the group favorite!

Maybe I was spoiled by Tryst the night before or maybe it just wasn't my type of club, but the only good thing about this club is the view of the strip. Lots of old school hip hop which i normally like to dance to, but the setup of the club/lounge wasn't what i expected. They have lots of empty couches that nobody can sit on bc it's RESERVED. Didn't like the carpeted dingy floors. One dance floor playing house and the hip hop was all over the place near the bar. Dancing was difficult with ppl bumping in to you trying to get over to the bar or the patio. Come for the view, leave for a better club.

Was just asked to leave our seats rudely to seat other people who apparently wanted to sit down. Who knows. Something about being reserved but no sign was posted. Very, very rude. Made us feel like like shit. They could give no explanation. Won't recommend anyone to come here. If this lack of disrespect can happen to us then watch out people.  They deserve 0 stars!!

If you want to unwind after gambling all day or walking the strip. This is the place to do it. It has secluded seating, a giant fireplace, the best view of the strip (from the top of Mandalay Bay), and some of the best food in town.  There staff is very friendly and helpful and the mood of the whole place really helps you to relax and get away from all the noise and chaos of the strip and casinos.  Whether your up here to just hang out in the lounge or for a full meal, you won't be disappointed. The only thing you need to be aware of is that it's not open to just anyone. You have to be on the guest list to be granted access to the private elevator. If your a VIP of the hotel though it's usually not an issue to get in.

Came on a club crawl. Was a great view. Place was a little packed and couldn't get a drink. Music was way too loud on the outside dance floor. Think someone farted in the elevator so that was a minus lol....Seriously it was gross....Bartender was a little bit rude but I'm sure just cuz she was busy. The on left with the tattoos....Overall a great place to check out once for sure

Do not miss one of the best views in the City, with great drinks and awesome bartenders. Cauliflower Tempura is to die for. Shout out to Sarah, Ozzy, and John who took great care of us. Good music in the evening too. Ask for John to make you a mai tai and you will not regret it.
Worst experience ever. The security guards think they are in the military. They are abusive and should all be fired . Don't waste a penny at this place. Will tell everyone I know!

Top marks for lounge space and view.   Bartender Hayley (Hailey?) hates the world. This chick should be pushing paper in a cubicle. Very obviously not cut out for her customer-facing job. After waiting patiently for 20 minutes, I politely asked for a drink. This request was met with Hayley's index finger. It should be noted that the lounge was not crowded.   I summoned the manager, who took care of my drink...and hopefully fired the grouchy bartender. I will return, and I will complain about Hayley until she puts on a happy face, or moves on to a clerical job. Not worth letting a bad bartender spoil an otherwise awesome place.

great view, sort-of, of the strip. it's at an angle, but still pretty decent. went to this place once, but fell in love immediately. the comfy couches and carpet scenery definitely created a great ambiance. the bartenders were pretty nice in my opinion, and when i made a mistake on an order, she let me go. i guess b/c i was nice, too... ne ways, the main room the night i was there had house music, some good tunes too might i add. only reason i wouldnt give it 5 stars is that the hip hop room was too small! the hip hop room is always too small in many places...shrug

Looking for a fancy night out? Try Foundation Room. The food is delicious, the service accommodating and friendly, and the ambiance deep, dark, and sexy. Start in the lounge for some unique craft cocktails (try the Night Cap- spirit forward and smooth). Ask for a private room if you want to get extra fancy and avoid the cacophony of the dining floor. Had the diver scallops- perfect sear and tender center. The bone-in rib eye was juicy and flavorful. Take a sip of your Faust Cabernet as you overlook the lights of the Vegas Strip and whisper, "I am so damn fancy." If you're lucky enough to have Barrett as your server, you'll be sure to have a memorable night.

First off, great view. Other than that, it's way too small, especially when they start roping every table off for bottle service only. We got comped a few free drink passes from a worker on the main floor of the casino, they were for champagne or a vodka drink. The Bartender refused to make a vodka drink and would only poor a shot of vodka, not even any ice. We then had to buy mixers for that "free drink". DJ was good, crowed was fun, but I most likely won't go back after the bartender thing.
Good food, small portions, and over priced.  I would not pay to be a member too many other good restaurants near by

I'm a fan for going early in the evening when it's not jam packed with people and you can get a seat on the patio, snuggle with your sweetie and enjoy the gorgeous view of the strip. Later it's just tooooooooo crowded! It used to be members only club back in the day and it was much better then.  If you are new to Vegas this is a great place to grab a drink and enjoy the view! If you like to people watch it can definitely get interesting. You never really know what kind of crowd will be there.
Awesome view, wonderful dinner, great ambience, good drinks! Thank you!

Called in reservation for my wife's bday. Requested a table with a view. The person who took the reservation was super nice and made special notes. When we arrived they sat us in the middle of the place even tho there were two tables open by the window. Asked politely to be moved which they did. Unfortunately we spent the next 40min (not exaggerating) waiting for a server to take our order. We literally had to waive down a server passing by with a pitcher of water to fill our glasses. Finally my wife asked to leave. We flew in from los angeles for this special night, and this place absolutely killed it. As we were leaving the hostess who sat us didn't remember that she sat us!  Crazy
Sweet strip view! Nice welcoming staff. Many Asian themed lounges.

I was invited up to the Foundation Room before a Foreigner concert. This was my first time in Cleveland and most certain NOT my last! I loved this place and their very friendly employees....one of the cocktail ladies was so nice she even gave us a VIP pass to her other place of employment. The concert at the House of Blues was AWESOME - and that is where we met a great friend named Vesty....We shared lots of stories and PBR in a can at that show....I will always keep him and Cleveland near and dear to my heart!

Hhmm..  It was nice. Probably not worth being a member there. Older crowd. (*wink wink* they parttay and ring their tabs in the thousands LOL) Women..go with women, they dont seem to mind or charge if you're all women (this excludes trans).   The only reason I give it 4 stars and not 5... SECURITY, PLEASE STOP LETTING THE PROSTITUTES IN!!!

Great place to take out-of-towners, especially if you know someone with a membership.  The view is spectacular.  A little pricey for food & drinks, but worth it.  Just be prepared for ultimate relaxation in their soft cushy sofas.  Next time, I think I'll go for a private room!
Hey guys, I absolutely love the Foundation Room! There's no venue that compares!
Best filet ive had so far. Im not sure it was the age/grade of meat or how it was prepared, but it was outstanding.The service was great, wonderful decor. We thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience.

Had a great time and music was good. We danced country in one room and top 40's in the other. Awesome decor and nice bar staff.   We are in the 40's and 50's age range and it was great for us. None of the oontz oontz music the younger crowd likes.

The Foundation Room is unique, laid back, kinda eerie, kinda exclusive, and should be visited at least once. I have not eaten there yet, only visited the bar. My wife and I asked if we were allowed to look around and got a private tour by a very nice waiter. Each room is decorated differently, and is really something to see. He said a lot of times the headline entertainers will come to the Foundation Room after performing. He also said he thinks the place is haunted. He said at night when they are closed, employees have heard a little girls voice in some of the rooms. Oh yeah, the view from the balcony outside the bar is second to none in Vegas. Being 48 stories up, outside and at the end of the strip, it is a great perspective.

This place is legit! I made a reservation a week in advance for my anniversary dinner and everything was fantastic. We arrived a little early downstairs to check in at the elevators and they confirmed my name on the reservation list and made sure we were dressed appropriately, then notified the hostess so she can seat us after the elevator ride. The lounge/restaurant is on the 63rd floor of Mandalay Bay and once you're up there, you have access to the restaurant and club/lounge. The restaurant is on the pricey side but it's so worth it. The food was great, although small portions, but we had dessert as well so we were good. The service was also great, they tend to you promptly and accommodate special occasions. I also have to mention the view of the strip from up there. It's the best view I've ever had of the strip and I've been in penthouse suites, the High Roller, and the Stratosphere. The lounge has the best view, but you can also get some good pictures right outside the restaurant. After our dinner we went to the lounge where they had a DJ and top 40 music. The crowd was mellow, which was understandable since it was a Monday night. Overall I highly recommend this place if you have a special occasion with your significant other and are willing to splurge a little.

Because there is no ZERO. What a hyped up joke and the view is terrible, JFC, The Mix is right around the corner if you want a view. With all there is to do in FLV, going to the airport home is better than going here.
Great great and great again loved the meal the view but Danny the waiter was the best we loved the place can't wait to come back

20 years later and still my favorite place to go have a drink and dance, people watch and just plain have fun.  The place is still swank and tasteful with just the right amount of cool factor without appearing to be trying too hard.   Have to credit the Director of Ops, Charo (sp) for helping me with making one of my clients have an incredible evening.  I contacted her and requested that he be given the VIP treatment as my guest (I could not attend) and she was absolutely ON IT.   From the moment he got taken up the private elevator to the end of the evening he was made to feel more important and special than most of us deserve.   Thank you Ms. Ronquillo for going above and beyond.   You truly are a professional!   Looking forward to meeting you in person on my next visit to Vegas to see my old favorite spot.   Gratefully and keep up the great work! Jason S. (Temecula, Ca.)
The view!!! Wow what a great place to get drunk and chat it up with random fun people  I wouldn't come for the music

Very cool!  We were treated by Lenovo to an open bar and a tasty array of snacks.  The macaroni and cheese was awesome- it was sprinkled with some sort of bread crumb/parmigiana cheese.  The brisket was tender and succulent, and the slider burgers were yummy too.  The coolest part of the Foundation room was the interior decor.  It may look gaudy to some, but i think it was just right for what they were going for.

It's the House of Blues.  Get passed the velvet roped elevator, sky rocket paste the penthouse and open those doors to the weird east asian looking statues with too many arms etc, and you know its the House, just with lower lighting.   $65 ($55 for members) buys you a 35 day dry aged (not in house), CAB (exclusively pre-Prime inspected like), Bone in, 16 oz Rib Eye steak, grilled to your order... Now I don't know what was weirder, the fact that this 16oz, clearly was mostly beef - because the bone was more like my thumb bone than the L or shank bone I'm used to, OR that because the bone was so small, that I was looking at a 16oz cut of meat that was Chicken Fried steak thickness... well I waste my words, the taste and the mouth experience was one of the best from any griller I've ever had.  If you're ordering the naturally slow dry aged meat, request there be no sauce accompanying it - even if their waiter described "better than A1" dressing... or even crusted, even though I love me some blue cheese on some beef... because of this, naturally speaking, grilled correctly, still purplish, that beef's texture is like smooth sashimi, butter knife slicing, only light salt and pepper touched, juicy, invigorating sweetness, to almost pierce your taste buds... and yes that was the meat sections - fat is room temperature butter smooth, taste locked in, the only topping you should have with each bite... I can still taste it.  Don't need support for this experience. Had them, don't remember them because of either the $20 beers per bottle, or the still vivid imagery of that meat. That's what she said.  It's the House of Blues.

Most terrible club/bar ever!!!   Being from miami I've been to my share of clubs.  This was absolutely the most horrible experience I've ever had!   1. The bartenders were standing to the left of the bar twirling their hair, while the lines at the bar built up.  2.  It was 90% 50+ year old men/women.  3.  The belly dancers (if you can call them that because all they did was rub on each other and the wall) were pushing people out of the way.  I'm sorry correct me if I'm wrong, but I thought I was the "customer" and they were the "entertainment".  How dare they push the guests out of their way with their wreck less idea of dancing?!  4.  Way too many people for such a tiny space!  5. They advertise free champagne for ladies however by the time you get to the bar it's too late!  Horrible horrible experience. Very disappointed in the Las Vegas nightlife. Who wants to wait 1 hr in line to enjoy music and drinks?! Not me!!

We enjoy this location.  The view of the Las Vegas Strip is really something to view and enjoy.  One of our favorite dishes is the Tempura Cauliflower, yum.  The wait staff is rather nice although there is one waitress that could use a major attitude adjustment.  Would definitely recommend for everyone to try.  Be sure to bring your camera, as I mentioned before, the view of the strip is amazing.

The boilerplate: Not the first to say it and I'm sure I won't be the last but WHAT A VIEW!! Recently coordinated a night out with some work colleagues from out of town. Wanted to avoid the overly crowded nightlife of Friday and Saturday nights so opted for Thursday. It was just as I remembered it WAY back in the day -- but better! The ambiance is elegant but trendy, the music gave the nightlife feel without the feeling of a sardine-packed dance floor,  and the air about the place just really said "class".  the rub: The 7 of us camped at one of the nice tables, even though we didn't opt for bottle service. The waitresses and manager came by a few times to make sure we were having a good time and to ensure service, blah, blah... the usual stuff. Inevitably, we were asked to get up --bummer! Being the host, naturally I felt embarassed so I approached the manager from earlier in the night to see about getting a table-- she must've seen the sheer disappointment in my face from knowing my group of gals couldn't imbibe as heavily as getting a bottle would require-- and without any word, she walked me back to my group, escorted us to some private, "members only" area, set us up ar another table, and brought us a round of drinks! Genuinely, the nicest gesture in all my times in nightclubs.  Needless to say, I instantly became the COOLEST coworker. Ok, that parts a lie. But seriously, had such an amazing night because of a generous gesture, especially for the girls who've never been to Vegas before! Thank you, Nina (?)-- sorry, music was loud-- for everything!!

Somehow I always end up at the Foundation Room while visiting Vegas. Located in Mandalay Bar, you take an elevator up to this smaller bar. Make sure to step out onto the balcony where you will take in one of the most beautiful views of the Las Vegas Strip you'll ever see.

Very GOOD restaurant. kind of a guys spot... Don't really know why but it wasn't overly romantic. The steak is is out of this world, get it with the horseradish Parmesan crust. The also have a great short rib app along with their oysters. For dessert try the bread pudding with an espresso!

**This Review is based on my dining experience** Made dinner reservations  online via OpenTable. Awesome dining experience from start to finish!!. Upon checking in at the reservation desk, we were given access to the  elevator to the restaurant. As soon as we stepped off the elevator, we were greeted by name  by a very warm and friendly host who directed us to the balcony since we were a bit early. The balcony has THE BEST VIEW OF THE STRIp!! It's breathtaking! The restaurant is dimly lit and nicely decorated which gives it a very romantic vibe!   The service was great and the food and cocktails were wonderful. We ordered the swordfish w/ asparagus and potatoes which was cooked and seasoned to perfection. We also ordered the chocolate cake for dessert. I have to say the  dessert portion was quite small however, it tasted very good. I highly recommend Foundation Room for a date night, a special occasion or if you just want an awesome view of Las Vegas and a great meal!

This place was awful!   Ordered médium rare rack of lamb and it wa well Done, and awful quality so we Ordered Rib eye to replace  it and it was even worse!!  The meat was frozen, and mashed potAtoes were instant, and we still paid $55 for the rib eye!!!  Do not waste your money!!!!

Top notch!!!  From the moment we went in until the time we left we were not disappointed.  We had VIP bottle service and our service could not have been better.  Great music, and the view..".the best in Vegas......will definitely return.

The only thing you should be coming here for is the view.  Grab a drink and enjoy the view.  And that's it.  Yea yea, the interior is cool - but not that cool if the entire staff is not friendly, not knowledgeable, and not professional.  Don't even think about eating here, the servers, busboys, food runners, so called "sommelier", all have no idea what is going on.  I think they were all on drugs (the incense is probably laced).  Drink menu should be given when you first sit.  Ours wasn't, so the server came and asked what we wanted to drink, then we asked for a drink menu.  10 minutes later it shows up.  We both order ribeye medium rare.  One comes out rare, the other comes out well done.  I can go on but I'll spare your eyeballs.  Like I said, come for the view.  But that's it.

I was impressed upon arrival. Then it was time for a cocktail or not! Two bartenders and we stood there for over 15 minutes never even getting a wave, wink or kiss my arse from the bartender of the manager standing there with her hands in her pockets. Once seated for dinner we finally got a glass of wine. We were a party of 10. I had to ask for bread twice to get any bread at our end of the table. Dinner, a not so tasty salad and two tiny crab cakes, $30! Our entire meal was $140 and we left feeling cheated and hungry. Neat place but overpriced and unimpressive food.

Amazing view!  COVER: $30 according to the website, but I'm not sure what we paid, because the bride-to-be booked in advance.  DRINKS: Because we booked in advance, we had our own tables and alcohol served there. Along with ice water! There were plenty of glasses for our 12+ group. Nice.  AMBIANCE: Zen buddha lounge theme entering the lounge. Pretty empty inside room with bar and plenty of couch seating. Walking pass that we eventually made it outside to experience a fascinate view of the strip. It was not overly crowded. People looked relaxed and enjoying the night. It was rather warm though, being outside and all. Wish there were misting units. The crowd was lacking younger college undergrads, sluts, and creepy grinding-feel-you-up guys - it was more of the young professionals place. Your IQ might even go up here.  OTHER: The manager (or equivalent) was attentive enough to introduce our party to our waitress.   MUSIC: Lots of Top 40 Hits (there was no way to escape "Moves like Jagger" in Vegas) and highlights from decades past. The volume was fine where we were.  VISIT DETAILS: Bachelorette party

I've been to Foundation Room at least 10 times but I had to write a review for Temple Saturdays hosted by Nightlife Guru.  I actually had the pleasure of being a guest DJ in the Temple of Boom room.  So awesome to see a classy joint like Foundation Room support local Electronic Dance Music.  All the previous times I had been to Foundation Room I only knew of one DJ area which is the main area by the bar.  There you typically will hear Top 40 Club music which is perfect for the tourist crowd.  Just outside the main area there is a killer patio that has an amazing view of the Strip from high above the Mandalay Bay.  There is seating out there with bottle service available and it's a great spot to either grab a smoke or have a conversation without having to raise your voice.  But lets face it, I'm loving Temple Saturdays because of the Untz Untz Untz beats they bring.  There is an additional patio area that features some great House Music.  Pat Schoolastra is the resident out there and the man behind Nightlife Guru.  He has been in the game for a long time and knows his House music.  This is real House Music folks which you rarely get to see in a club on the Strip.  The Temple of Boom is the room I was able to guest DJ in and I was stoked to see this room being put to good use.  The music you find in this room is the cutting edge sounds of Electro and Dubstep.  I even had the pleasure of seeing Teenwolf Remix drop some Moombahton here which is the latest EDM genre to hit the scene.  Vegas is becoming the EDM capital of North America and it is nice to see Foundation Room embracing the local talent.  Few other things worth mentioning are all 3 areas have their own bar with reasonably priced drinks.  Also it is smooth entry as long as you're not wearing shorts, flip-flops, baseball caps, or sports attire.  Big props to Nightlife Guru for Temple Saturdays and much love to Foundation Room for giving them a shot.

Some of the best views on the strip can be found at the foundation room. We came here for my wife's birthday party. We had a delicious dinner, great service, terrific wine, and then bottle service and dancing afterwards in the nightclub. You will enjoy yourself, but certainly bring your credit card.

I attended but was refused entry on dress code. I had evacuated the hurricane in Florida and only packed tailored shorts and leather Olukai sandals. My shoes were classier than the doorman's t-shirt. I have never been turned away from a venue before today.

This has always been one of my favorite hangouts seeing as I'm not really into nightclubs and this place is a great place to get some decently priced drinks, dance and enjoy that awesome view. Its always hit or miss at the door though, the employees tend to be a little full of themselves. Edgy House of Blues inspired lounge? It is. Hottest most exclusive club in Las Vegas? It's definitely not. However the employees seem to think so. I was at the casino with some friends and we wanted to stop by and grab a quick drink on our way out. We couldn't though because we were denied entry because the "bouncer" didn't like my friend's shoes. I'm all for a dress code, I work on the strip, I get it. But mind you we had just left another club, it was around 2:30am, no line to get in, nothing. I've always loved telling my friends and coworkers about this place, but I think it's time for me to find a new favorite. Las Vegas has no shortage of great music and incredible views, and I'd rather take my money where I'm welcome.

The room and view are very nice but I cannot say the food was exceptional. Good, but not exceptional which it should be at these prices. Nor was the primary server, although her assistant was very good. The steak was good but it might have been choice instead of prime which it should have been at $48. Grouper was very good on a lovely risotto. Caesar salad was excellent but it was ordered with anchovies and without croutons and came just the opposite. Many Las Vegas restaurants filter their tap water to eliminate the chlorine taste, but they did not and I had to order two bottles of still water at an outrageous $10 each. Wine list by the glass was very nice. All in all a decent place but there are many better on the Strip for this kind of money.

Went there first time last week with a few colleagues, one of them was a member. We had a drink at the bar, the bartender was very attentive.  We then went upstairs to the restaurant. All appetizers were really good, esp the chicken lollipops (i think thats what they were called). I ordered the short rib and it was excellent. Others had the prime rib and the steak and were very happy as well. Service was quick and friendly, would definitely come back.

Was in town for the marathon and wife, me and another couple wanted a light supper and drinks in a fun location.  Took advantage of the Lounge extended Happy Hour Nibbles & Sips till 8PM on Monday, 11/13.  Greeted graciously, not very crowded at 6PM.  Drinks were fine, old fashioneds for the guys, $5 wines for the ladies.  The specials menu of mussels, cauliflower Tempura, Korean BBQ and chicken skewers with a ghost pepper dipping sauce were good.    Very nice vibe in the lounge, music not too loud to prevent conversation and waitress was attentive.  We enjoyed it so much the other couple went back after the MICHAEL Jackson One show in the same hotel.  Would recommend.

Last night 5/30/10 was our second time having dinner at the HOB Foundation Room. Both times we got the special. Last night it was extra special. We both had the "Napa Valley Weekend" a 4 course dinner with wine pairing.  Course 1: Braised Pork Belly with a fennel crust, sweet and spicy turnips paired with Chateau St. Michelle  Course 2: Pan Roasted Langoustine with zucchini and wild mushroom paired with Far Niente Chardonnay.  Course 3: Kobe NY Strip steak with summer artichoke and roasted fingerling potatoes, paired with Frank Family Cabernet Sauvignon  Course 4: Hot fudge cake with key lime sorbet. and paired with Far Niente, Dolce  The only complaint is the last wine pairing. It was way to sweet with the fudge cake. I would suggest maybe a special coffee or choc martini possibly.  The wait staff was excellent. Looch and Ryan  The view is beyond belief from the 42th floor of mandalay bay Hotel
Can't beat the view up here! Undermined only by the douchey bouncers. Fun outside patio to have a drink at the top of the Strip. Decent beer selection.

Jackson:  I entered the Foundation Room and immediately found a seat in the middle. Surrounded on all sides compounded with the loudness of the noise outside made me feel a bit claustrophobic. Although I was sweating and a bit nervous, I was able to enjoy my stay after needing a few minutes to acclimate. Dismount was difficult due to spaced out walls. Pretty good, but could use some renovations from an expert.  Lewis:  I had quite a good time while i waited for my brother to finish whatever he was working on. The people in the Foundation Room all accepted my presence with open arms, literally hugging me as they left! Jackson finished and i heard the walls groan as he raised up. And so - it was my turn... the warmth of the seat was nice, automatic 4 stars from me! I worked fast and efficient and left just in time to see my brother hugging someone at the exit. These people sure are friendly!

They'll take your money but only if you're in the finest of dress apparently.  Can't believe a place that claims to be based on the blues would reject people for a guy wearing a nice pair of new Levi's, Timberland shoes and an NFL logo coach's sideline polo.  She was wearing a nice blouse and jeans as well.  When they wouldn't even suggest we bother going to the elevator from the shop where you get your tickets, we wondered why our money wasn't as good as anyone elses.  She literally told us we wouldn't be accepted as we weren't wearing formal attire.  Really?  For the Blues?  And on top of this on a hotel comp?  Then the server has the audacity to ask us if we'd like to dine in the restaurant instead.  Seriously?  So we went to "The Strip" steak house, dressed as is, and dropped $250 on dinner there instead.    The dumbass server didn't even get the irony of refusing us service while standing in front of the sign talking about not being able to pay the rent, getting dumped, losing a job.   Enjoy your tour of the blues, if you're good enough.    Signed,   The guy that shopped at the same old Pepper Tree Market on Laurel  and Safeway on San Carlos Avenue as John Lee Hooker when I was a kid.  I'd love to have him back to join me on a trip to this pretentious piece of shit that supposedly honors his legacy.
I usually don't give reviews, but our VIP host Will, was amazing last Saturday! Definitely helped us with what we needed and made the experience at FR memorable. The view is amazing!
Went up there in the evening one night for drinks only... The view is amazing but after that nothing too great about it.  Very comparable to Ghost Bar.

We found this place by chance on yelp. We rented a room to host a party from 6-10 the service was okay everyone was happy with the food and most importantly my wife was happy.   The view of the city from the balcony was beautiful and great for taking photos and enjoying a few drinks.   The real party starts around 11 and trust me you will not be disappointed. When I say the ladies came out I really mean absolutely gorgeous women came out to entertain and believe me they did not disappoint. The ladies in our group all mentioned how beautiful the girls were and they were all friendly and happy to oblige with photo ops. I must add the entertainment was nothing raunchy but very well done and classy.   This is a must see event and ladies drink free.
AMAZING views and ambiance at this club/restaurant/bar! The prices are on par with Strip prices. I will definitely go back! I would love to be a member to have access to the private rooms!

Customer service and bouncers here are the absolute worst. Was here for the first stop of my best friends Bachelorette party. Bouncers cursed at us to get the F out of their way (we already were, and we were sober at this point). And they spilled our drinks on myself and the bride 3x! Umm really?!  We are all educated women, most of whom are in the air force. Not some idiots making fools of ourselves. The atmosphere was OK and the view outside was really nice. But after the way we were treated, there's no way we would ever go back here. Plus we were told this was a more relaxed and chill lounge environment. Nope. Just a mini club with the most awful customer service ever. I'm giving this rating two stars because when I told the man who runs the place, he apologized and offered to take care of us for next time.

This was my fourth time at Foundation and it's consistently been great.  Part of the fun is the exclusive elevator ride up and of course the view, but the food isn't anything to sneer at either. Started off with the chicken lolipops and also the pork belly tacos.  The lolipops came with a duo of blue cheese and buffalo sauces. The pork belly tacos came in soft shell corn tortillas (like they should) and had a handful of fixins on them. I got a New York strip with Foundation steak sauce and the lady got a filet with blue cheese.  Both were done nicely. We skipped dessert and hung out on the balcony for a bit.  The views are tough to beat.  Great place to spend your night.

Zen and then some pow - this is a quirky bar in that it has an old asian mens club thing going on. There are private rooms for bottle service or public leather seating around fireplaces for it as well. Music is good but i only like it on occasion. I forget which night is best but once a week its pretty hopping. Mondays? Ask around. I guess they serve apps but I dont remember that. The outside balcony looks over all of vegas.

Daisy K will confirm, I am not one to be thrilled by a membership oriented club, however, the Foundation Room seems to set itself apart from my general disdain of places like this.  The decor is awesome, funky, ecclectic, and perfect for a higher end, rock oriented joint. The artwork is all authentic, which sent me over the edge being an art history major (leaving the art history behind shortly after college however, to make a bit more money!).  Excellent spots for private functions.  Great drinks, great service.  SPECTACULAR views of the strip from the outdoor patio.

Nice place to go and check out the view from the balcony at the top of Mandalay Bay.  It's right next to the Mandalay Bay sign so you're up 40 some odd stories so the view is staggering.  I always wonder why I don't come here more often since I'm a member but for some reason, there's so many different places to go in Vegas, I kind of forget about this place.  Maybe it's cuz the crowd is a bit older and it's hit or miss on whether or not it's going off or not...but for whatever reason, I should make it up here more often because whenever I take out-of-towners here, they are pretty amazed.  Btw, food in the dining room is great too.  So, if you know a member (or if you know me) coax them to get you up to this joint.  You won't regret it.

Really love this place for a cocktail. Super exclusive rooms upstairs all dimly lit. Super plush decor, great drinks, and amazing views. Awesome place to go grab a drink in an upscale environment with upscale people.

This is a very well-executed space.  It's home is the top floor of the Mandalay Bay & the entire layout has a very "exclusive" feel to it.  There were not many expenses spared when it was being furnished.  Everything is very modern without feeling like they were attempting to predict the future (which is a feeling I often get in more modernized spaces) & there is an awesome outdoor bar area - in the lounge - that overlooks the Vegas Strip.  The service was excellent, with nobody having to look for attention when they needed something.  The servers were always nearby without being TOO attentive - we were still able to enjoy a fairly private happy hour followed by a similarly private meal.  The dining room we ended up in had huge windows that also overlooked the Strip which made for a nice dinner setting.  The food was excellent as well.  Our party tried the scallops, crab cakes, prime rib, Asian rack of ribs, roasted cauliflower & another dish which I can't remember right now.....and then we finished it all off with bourbon-vanilla gelato for the whole table.  I will most definitely be returning here for another meal next time I find myself in Sin City.
Great food, the filet was amazing Oscar style. Great service and views / ambience. The only complaint is I wish they had a better dessert menu, otherwise this place is fantastic.

Cozy, swanky, and earthy is the best way I could sum up this place. We went here last night after watching the Barrett-Jackson auction for a couple of hours.  We had dinner reservations at another hotel, so couldn't spend too much time, but for the time we were there, we absolutely loved it.   We were there very early about 7:30, the sun had set and the view was incredible. It feels like you are literally sitting inside the city skyline.   There were also a couple of hidden rooms behind the main lounge that we went into. One with a view of the south end of the strip.   We will definately be back in the very near future to relax and indulge.

Without a doubt The Foundation Room has the most spectacular view of the strip.  I haven't had the opportunity to have dinner there but certainly is a great place to hang out and have drinks.  The weekends are crazy with warriors but during the week is chill and definitely is more "grown up" then some of the other establishments in Vegas.  If you're in the industry, Monday nights are the nights to go.

Ate there this week with a big group while in LV for a conference. definitely worth the drive down the strip. the view from the patio is incredible and the food was incredible.  I had the sea bass which was cooked well, my only complaint would be that the skin was slightly soggy and not as crisp as expected. One of my friends had the short ribs which were delectable, perfectly cooked and it took a lot of conviction not to steal his plate and eat most of the meal.  I would def recommend a visit for the view and stay for the food.

Definitely feels like a VIP rooftop club. If you get lucky, you might bump into a promoter in the hotel who will give you free tickets to get in. It helps if you have women with you, haha! Once you get on the roof, the inside club is pretty nice, but small. It's worth the trip to go outside on the roof though. You'll be able to see the whole Vegas Strip and enjoy some champagne. Definitely worth the visit just for the view at night!

We were there Sat evening before the Madonna concert at the MGM across the way.  Classy joint, funky, eclectic decor, very welcoming, relaxing and chic.  I felt right at home there.  The place was dead but according to the bartender, the place doesn't get going until 11p with DJ and dancing.    Surprisingly our drinks were well priced.  We've paid a lot more for the same stuff at other bars along the strip.    5 Stars for the view.  It is truly amazing.  -1 Star for no "specialty drink" menu.  Although the bartender was creative with our request it would be nice to have specialties to choose from, especially since professional mixologists do an awesome job at combining unusual and unexpected flavors.  If you go, try to check out the different themed rooms for private dining, partying, etc.  What a superb gem in Vegas and exclusive too.  They only let non-members in on Mondays.    Luckily I was able to get a temporary pass through my credit card for FREE....feeling like a big baller when I'm really not :)

Do you know why it is awesome being a girl?  Because we get ushered up to places we would have never found on our own.  It was a Monday night, and a few of my girls and I had just finished a nice dinner at Mandalay Bay.  As we are walking through the hotel, someone asks us if we want to go to the Foundation room, and next thing I know, I am up at the top, greeted by the smell of incense and dark décor.  When we walk through the bar area, it was just a bunch of guys holding drinks staring into the small room.  So we walk out onto the patio and we find out that:  The view of the strip is spectacular!  My fear of heights has dissipated at this moment, and I just took in this incredible view of all the lights up the strip.  We also happened to see Dog the Bounty Hunter on the balcony, but that's another story.  We got a few drinks, sat on the nice comfy couches, and took in the scene for a while.  Nice to check out, but not much room for dancing, and it got pretty crowded, even for a Monday.

This place is special. Finally something different than every other sterile tourist trap on the strip. The decor is rich in history and deep in ambiance. The service was second to none. The food was perfect and the wine was wonderful. Best view in Vegas. I will go back and I will stay longer.

I went to the Foundation Room for a wedding reception this past summer and was blown away.  It was a destination wedding and was a smaller crowd of about 40 or so and we had a private area reserved on one side of the balcony.  There was a separate bartender for guests, as well as a DJ spinning for us.  The security was polite but firm with those who tried to wander over to our area.  The inside of the restaurant is richly decorated with an Asian vibe and is beautiful.  The outside balcony needs no decoration because it towers over the strip and provides you with the most magnificent view in all of Vegas.  Seriously, it's amazing.  The restaurant also provided buffet style dinner for all the guests and the manager came out on more than one occasion to make sure that everything was going well.  We had been to the Cat House at the Luxor the night before for a welcome party and I know that the bride had a really bad experience with the management there, so she was extra appreciative of the attentiveness of the staff at the Foundation Room.  I can't speak for the prices of the drinks, since it was open bar for us.  However, if you're looking for cheap drinks, you're better off sticking to a college town than coming to Vegas.  Everything is expensive!  I enjoyed the exclusivity of having our own space at such a fabulous place in Vegas and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to have a classy wedding in Vegas, or an upscale bachelor/bachelorette party with a bunch of friends.  I added some pictures on here, but you're dying to see more, you can do so here: http://bit.ly/chhqTs

Beautiful ambiance. .. Food was ok Shrimp and Grit. My husband had short ribs Very Good! When I got my check there was drinks I never even consumed :/ he said "sorry wrong table" not true because it was exactly what we ate and cocktails we had but he added other drinks in there. Great view very expensive but worth the experience

$35 for really really bad tacos on stale tortillas....the actual room the restaurant was in was cool, but this food was crap.  I was so upset about this because I could have gone to any nice restaurant in a town full of them but wasted a meal on this garbage.

Great place!  Love the decor, the amazing view down the strip and for once a place with reasonable music.  I was here as part of a conference so I honestly don't know what the process is to get in otherwise but if you're in Vegas and looking for a great view and a really funky atmosphere this is the place to go.

If it is supposed to be locals night on monday don't ask me for cover. Its an alright lounge but I am not paying cover for the right to purchase over priced drinks. I left they can keep their liquor on the shelves  I have been there before its a nice view but not worth the hassle.

What a great dining experience! We originally had reservations for the dining room, but decided to eat in the lounge instead. The view is amazing!! More importantly though - the wait staff/bar staff were extremely friendly, helpful with questions, and attentive. Service was near impeccable (with the exception of one female bartender who seemed a bit clueless). The ambiance was great  - music volume perfect, seating was comfortable, and there was much to look at all around. We ordered some food from the happy hour menu and some from the regular menu. Everything was delicious! The venue is so unique, it would be nice to see a menu reflective of that - maybe some choices that are unique and different, but regardless, everything was tasty. Would definitely return and would recommend to all of our friends!

So amazing!  The service was incredibly attentive and personal - every suggestion was spot on.  We ordered:  "Twice Cooked" Mediterranean Baby Octopus with Crispy Potatoes Rosti, Marinated Radish Salad and Herb Shallot Vinaigrette - Highly recommended!    Baby Arugula Green Salad with "Fried" Gorgonzola Toasted Walnut Cheese, Marinated Cipollini Onions, and Crisped Parma Prosciutto - I'm not a fan of the fried gorgonzola as it's not my thing, but the balsamic cipollini onions were so flavorful and deliciously (not nauseatingly) sweet.  Chicken Flatbread - Tasty but way too much carbs for me, I'd like to try the duck breast next time.  Pinot Noir Mac Murray - a nice value wine. Not tannic and very smooth.  "ChocoFlan" - Espresso/Cocoa Cake with Silky Caramel Vanilla Flan and Toasted Hazelnut Nougatine - The Nougatine was the perfect foil to the soft flan texture.  Um yeah, needless to say, I need to hit the gym.  HARD.

One of the BF's friends in Vegas was able to get us on this list for this amazing lounge. If you have the chance to hang out in the Foundation Room, go! It's an amazing experience.   For me, the atmosphere of this place is what puts it over the top. The entire lounge has a very sophisticated Asian theme. The walls are upholstered in red and orange patches of mirrored Indian fabric. The doors are heavily carved and you'll see Buddhas here and there. The couches and chairs also provide comfortable places to hang out. The balcony offers an amazing view of the strip.   The DJ was very good the night we were there. She played great music and kept the volume loud enough to keep the party going without making it so loud that you couldn't talk to the people around you.   Surprisingly, the drinks are reasonably priced for a lounge like this. The bartender also remembered what all four folks in my party were drinking. I am sure she was thrilled we drank round after round between our arrival around 11:00 PM and when the joint closed down at 3:00 AM. I agree with others that it was a bit odd this place didn't have a speciality drink menu.   Overall, this place rocks!

Food was alright, not worth the cost. The view was nice. Drinks were also alright. I would recommend you instead go somewhere else for better food and have a more delicious drink and view at skyfall  at at the Delano. Service was great though. View was better at skyfall bar and probably at the rivea restaurant. If I could do it all over again I'd just do rivea and skyfall. Decorations were really cool though. I think the club at night would be cool to check out.

Amazing food!!!  Amazing service!!  Always a fan favorite!! I had the lamb. Someone had the scallops. Someone had the halibut. And someone had the filet. All was amazing!!! Staff was awesome. Luche and the server was great!  Answered all our questions. Put up with our antics. Offered great suggestions!!

We came here for a Lenovo convention welcome reception.  The open bar was incredible with any choice of drinks we wanted.  The Buffet spread was also really well executed and delicious.  The only mild complaint was it was very warm, not sure if was because the outside doors were opening and closing or ac was on the fritz.  I'd go back for another party though, the view was amazing!!

The best part of going to Foundation Room is the SPECTACULAR VIEW of the Las Vegas strip!!! That would be a perfect spot to propose your woman too! Am I right?!   I went here to a friend of a friend's birthday and she had her own separate room with bottle service and its wow! The decor is beautiful. I can't really recall how the music is - I was mostly drinking and socializing. I still had a great time.

This place has a great view, but the service is horrendous!!! The redhead bartender on a Saturday literally said "why are you looking at me".  Ummmmm because you're the frickin bartender and I need a drink!!!!! She is bitter and needs some customer service training!!! She didn't even give me the right drink! She's awful! Don't get into the service industry if you're angry at life.  Wouldn't recommend this place.  Gave one star because I have to rate.  I give her a -5.

Don't do it! After paying a $400 "entrance fee" to see fireworks on New Years Eve, we were harassed terribly. Our fun New Years made a disturbing turn when they gladly took our money and told us it was for viewing fireworks, then we were constantly bullied by security telling us that we had to move or go somewhere else. No management was available to talk to. There also was no reason for constantly moving us. This was miserable and we were made to feel badly by their staff. Don't give them your money!

Always a good time at this place. Thursday night is a little more mellow than usual but it works out perfect ! Can't beat the view of the Las Vegas strip .!  Start your night here you won't regret it ! Shout out to my boy JP for hookin up the table

When baiting clients, no trick is too low.  At the door I asked the bouncer if there was any people up there. He said it was but it would cost me $20. Seeing no line whatsoever I was hesitant but went along. When I got up the place was dead, 10 min later they close down because it's so slow.  I'll admit that the decor and view is good but a club that hustles clients can never get more than a 1*.

I went here for the first time this past weekend (my parents are members), and I had an absolutely fantastic time! Our waitress was amazing, the food come out in a very timely manner and it was delicious. The after we ate upstairs, we went downstairs and had a few cocktails before the Cavs game. I love the overall atmosphere of the place - I read in another review that said the decor reminded them of a hookah bar, and I can def see that in how the place is decorated. I just cannot say enough about how great the staff is that works there. The mystery of trying to find it is pretty cool too - I would not have been able to find the place on my own if I wasn't with my parents. Great job! I cannot wait to go back.

We had reservations at 7:15 and they knew we had tickets to a show at 9:00. We arrived early to see if we could get seated early. We finally left at 7:50 because we still had not been seated. They kept promising they would get us seated. Ridiculous. Will never go back.
What Steven G. says!!! They suck (except for the great waitress!) I'm still fighting my credit card charge with them! Justice will triumph!!!
THE best view in Vegas!  Friendly staff, good people, all smiles, but the view, oh, that view!

I came here last Saturday 1/31/15, had the best time. Truly one of the best views in Vegas on that balcony. Everyone was super friendly - from the bartenders to security, even the bathroom attendant was a total doll! I will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas.
It's worth a look just to see the view from the terrace and the over-the-top decor.  I'd like to come here wearing a Members Only jacket just to bask in the irony.

Every once in a while you accidently find a hidden gem by accident. The foundation room was just that. While at Mandelay Bay to eat at the burger bar we were redirected to check out the foundation room after asking for directions out of the Casino. On the 40th floor the Foundation room can only be described as posche. From the cool Asian artifacts to the amazing view of the strip the foundation room has upsacle eligance down. For dinner I had the Filet with blue cheese topping. The steak here was cooked to prefection. I can honestly say it was one of the best i have ever had. For dessert I had the ice cream samplers. They were all homemade and very good. Portion sizes here were good also except I felt the ice cream was small for the price. The table service was top notch. I really appreciated not being rushed through dinner. Over all one of the best dinning experiances I have had.

This place has really got to be upgraded. It's disgusting inside... it smells like a combination of sweat and incense sticks/hookah. This could be a really great, hip area, but I just felt as though I was sitting on people's discharge, dried sugary drinks, and sweat. The drinks were basic, nothing special and something I could get at any other bar in Vegas.   It also seemed to me that this was a perception among many people there- as they came up, get a drink (because they feel obligated to), take some pictures of the view, and then leave.

First off, understand that when I go out I want to dance not just "chill" or "hang" or whatever... so knowing that, read the rest  I feel like the foundation room is filled with people who couldn't get into Ghostbar.  The view is rad, and we got there around midnight with no line whatsoever.  I enjoyed sitting on the patio, people watching, but kinda wanted to move on to the next club, which was PURE... and was filled with dancing people.    Three stars for strong drinks and a good view, and three stars for lack of fun things to do besides make fun of d-bags hanging out looking for trainwrecks.

Our wedding took place at the HOB Foudation Room on 6/26/16 and it could not have turned out any better. Kelly was so easy going and professional to work with for both ceremony and reception. Very punctual with emails and returning phone calls, and made sure everything went smoothly. Mike and Ryan assisted the day of the wedding and were so helpful and on top of things. The food provided by FR was amazing, so there is no need to look for outside catering; Our wedding guest were blown away by the food and it's quality, defiantly not your typical wedding buffet style meal. We can not say enough about our wedding day experience with both Kelly and the FR; and I don't want to leave out the fact that the staff members were great as well. A unconventional option worth checking out for a wedding. Superb!!!   I could say so much more about this beautiful artsy location, but just that everything was amazing and worth every penny!!!

What a view from the patio! That's what makes the $10 drinks tolerable.  A little weird dancing on carpet with heels on... but it works. The decor is so cool and eclectic. Tons to look at.  Great music playing and videos above the bar. I was having 90s flashbacks. Did you notice to private lockers for celebrities near the elevators. Very cool.

I called and booked a reservation for The Foundation Room and spoke to a gentleman. I specifically stated I am not a member of the foundation room but asked if I can still eat there for restaurant week.  The gentleman stated no problem because it's restaurant week. He confirmed the reservation for 6:30. When I arrived at 6:27 I was greeted by a woman who stated she could not find my reservation. I explained I just made the reservation earlier that day and maybe it wasn't in their system yet. I then explained I made the reservation with a gentleman and asked if she could check with someone. She advised she doesn't know who I'm talking about. I asked if I could go upstairs and speak with someone as there must be a mistake. She said no!   I can't believe the incompetence displayed by this business. It was a truly disappointing experience.

The Foundation Room has a funky oriental decor and the ambiance is a little dark and mysterious. The view outside is breathtaking. The crowd is on the older side - I would say half of them are in their late 30's and early 40's. If you are in your early 20's this place is probably not for you. It's definitely worth checking out once in your life time - you'll have to decide yourself if you want to return.

As a frequent visitor of Vegas, I never really visit the Mandalay Bay due to its far location at the end of the Strip. This past Valentine my boyfriend and I went to dine and hang at Mandalays on a Sunday evening, a change from the typical Cosmo/Aria scene. The promoter from the Foundation room stopped us and handed us drink/entry passes in the casino. Another guy walked us into the lounge/club located all the way near the top of the hotel (but below MIX) I think? Don't really know which floor.. I was buzzed.   Anyway, it was a pleasant surprise! The antique furniture gave a very classy/vintage vibe. Bar had a good variety of specialty drinks and wine selection. Bartender had excellent etiquette, came over and lit me up when she saw me pull out my Mild 7s :) DJ was spinning old school hip hop with top 40 mix. Surprisingly, I was not bored. Most likely I was amused by the spectacular view of the Strip from the balcony and the drunk gay guy prancing/cat-walkin' around the dancefloor all night to every single song.  I would definitely take my friends here on future Vegas trips.

This place has the best views! We were on the list for the lounge and stopped by after a show. It was really empty inside except in the patio where everyone was enjoying the view. We didn't stay long but it was definitely worth it to take pictures and get away from the crowds for a bit.

This place has a GREAT view. This Lobster Tail special was OUT OF THIS WORLD. Couldn't recommend it enough. Also got sides of mac and cheese and mashed potatoes which were just okay. Server was semi good... she didn't come around a lot and was a little slow. Overall still 5 stars and I will be back.

There are really only two things you need to know about the Foundation Room:  1. It's on the roof of Mandalay Bay, and has an EXCELLENT view of the Strip. 2. Scantily clad dancers - in bustiers, fishnets, cheekie panties & heels. HEAVENLY.  The drinks were pretty good, too. The bartenders were friendly and quick, and a bit heavy handed.   All in all, it's a pretty place!

We were guests of a company party hosted at the Foundation Room. If you want a place to impress this is definitely it. Awesome balcony and view! Really memorable. The bar service was good. The catered food was average. The lounge was pretty sexy. Worth the trip.  Food: 3/5 (catered, buffet apps) Drink: 4/5 - Selection not the best Venue: 5/5

Door Hosts are very, very rude. I came to the door wearing black dress shorts (when it was 105 outside) and a dress shirt and was denied entry, yet several girls walked right in wearing ugly jean shorts and T-shirts. When I mentioned it, the door host became loud and said to shut up. The crowd is nasty and the place has slowly gone down hill over the last 10 years.  I understand that in NV the casinos are allowed to discriminate and treat people poorly, but this guy took it to another level. If you are a local, don't patronize this place. They don't deserve it.

I love me some Foundation Room. Literally, the last three times I have gone to Vegas I have made it a point to pop into the Foundation Room. Two of the times were for cocktails, views of the strip, and some dancing. I love the lounge feel and that there isn't a million people packed into one room. Much more enjoyable!  The most recent time was for dinner with one of their members. Wow, talk about the perks of being a member! The VIP lounges and event space is absolutely gorgeous! Not to mention the top notch service!  For dinner, the two highlights for me were the fried cauliflower and the Korean buns. Holy smokes! I am salivating just thinking about them. I think during the course of dinner, we managed to order each item three different times because they were THAT good. I have even ordered fried cauliflower at other restaurants hoping for a piece of the same deliciousness, but no one has it down like the Foundation Room!
I've contacted Sasha/business rep per her reply to my review. I've recd no response. At this point there's no point to discuss anything further.

Nice place, reservations was simple, getting seated was fast, great menu selection, after dinner party had great vibes.....easy to order drinks and have a cigar and the view was killer.  Will be back!
Sweet spot on top of the strip.  Swanky, dark, funky decor and people watching makes this a fun spot.  Definitely recommend as a must see in Las Vegas.

Was here for UFC fight night and the place did not disappoint! Great customer service from attentive staff and the food was perfect. Decent wine selection and the good mixology skills made for a perfect Ild Fashioned drink!  Very nice decor inside with high tops and couches to sit at while you enjoy the food and drink.  Outside there were strong heaters (outside in March can get chilly) and more comfy couches to relax and converse with friends or meet new people.   Great experience!!

This place is not special at all.  How it's members only?  I don't know.  Initially you're greeted with the lounge area that feels like some private party, not a happening scene.  The saving grace of the place is having a drink with a view of the strip.  The food was okay.  The lobster salad for $18 was HORRIBLE.  I wouldn't go back.

My experience was not what I expected food took over 35 minutes to come out when it finally did rack of lamb was raw and fatty. It was a huge let down we sent the lamb back twice it felt as if we were an inconvenience to the staff .
We visit the Foundation room every time were in Vegas.(about twice a year) Favorite place out there! Otto the waiter that we request is great. Like family. Place is a must!
excellent.....all around atmosphere is amazing. service 5 stars. Recommend to all. The views are breathtaking

Extremely disappointing. We were looking for a high end option to celebrate our 2 birthdays. First, service was extremely slow even though the restaurant was only about half full. Hoping that the food would make up for the slow service but no.  Started with the Seared Jumbo Shrimp. Nothing jumbo about it. Just 2 small shrimp. No value for $21. The Cajun lemon beurre blanc that the shrimp were presented in was excellent. Unfortunately the best part of the meal.  First entree Skuna Bay Salmon, over cooked, dry and fishy. At 40 bucks a pop save your money. Second entree Pan Seared Diver Scallops, better, but not by much. These too were over prepared.  Bottom line, my wife and I don't have problem spending money on dining out, and we even expect to pay a little more considering the venue. But, if your going to charge me a $170 out the door, please make it a dinner worth eating.

So it's Monday night, our last night in Vegas. The hotel had begged us with offers to come and visit the Foundation Room on the 63rd floor, 'Vegas's longest running nightclub.'. Brayden, a gentleman near the elevators and casino floor accosted us a twice since we had been staying at the hotel (Mandalay Bay).  We were given these tickets for free cover before midnight and also a free cocktail.  We get there just a few minutes before midnight and take the elevator up to the top.  Getting off we approach the bar, show our drink tickets and were refused... it was only a few minutes after and the elevator ride took a minute. Gee wiz!  After the disappointment with the bar, we went outside to see the view.  Oh and what a view!  Very much worth the ride up.  We snapped some photos and vibed with the music a little.  We went back inside to dance and the place was almost a ghost town.  I get that it's a Monday but the place was empty!  We stayed a little, danced by ourselves in the aisle near the bar and left as they were closing just before 1am.   Cool vibe, neat place, great views- too bad no people!

Heard about this place because we are Club Corp members. Saturday night, made our reservations and came for dinner and drinks. View was amazing.   Everything was going well, hanging out at the members only lounge until one of the hostess kicked us out of the club around 10:30pm because she saw my fiancee "stumbling." The only drink she's had was the bubbly drink they gave us a stub for. Mind you, she was wearing heels. It is very dark inside and floors may have been slippery, but we were not given a chance to explain.   It was a very humiliating experience getting kicked out and calling her intoxicated in front of my guests whom I had invited because we are Club Corp members. I have been to several private clubs & country clubs affiliated with Club Corp and we have never been kicked out and treated this way. It may have been because it's Vegas? Maybe it was getting crowded? But they have to work on their hospitality.   The night was an extreme disappointment  for my fiancee and called it a night with our guests around 11:00pm as we only planned on hanging out at Foundation Room that night because of our membership affiliation with them.

First and foremost let me say that the Mandalay Bay hotel is AMAZING and their guest services were fantastic, beautiful hotel and I would definitely stay there again. On the other hand, I didn't have the greatest experience when i came to their 'night life'   Two of my girlfriends and I were making our way through the Casino to get to the tram because we had a couple places to go meet some people at over in NY NY. A man approached us with those free admission cards to get into the Foundation room. We for sure wanted to check it out, so we told him we would come back later because we needed to go somewhere else first. He was super nice and said he'd be there the rest of the night and to come find him when we want to get in. So.. we did, we left ROK over at the New York, which was pretty fun - and made our way back to Mandalay. Found the guy and he walked us to the door man and said 'have fun!' well, the door man - his name is Demitri, didn't even look up to smile he just asked for our ID's and 10$ ... it was about 12:30am by this time. I'm not a pre madonna but i'm also not going to pay 10$ at midnight when i left the club i was at before where i got in free. You ladies know how great it is in Vegas cause everywhere is free.. so we went back to find our guy and he walked us up to the door assuring Demitri it was OK that we get in for free. Demitri went off - telling us that no one is getting commission for the 3 of us to get in, and throwing it in our faces making it seem like we're robbing this guys job. I looked at the other guy who had been helping us and he was SO nice and again, assured Demitri it was OK for us to get in and he didn't care. I wish i could have gotten the nice guys name, but i was sure to get Demitri's on my way out because that is no way to treat people, especially ones who are paying a lot of money to stay at their hotel AND on alcohol once we got up there.   Fortunately the view was worth the harassment but i can't say i'll ever recommend someone to go there unless they want the door man to put up a fight with them or pay to get in when you can get in for free pretty much anywhere else!
Best view of the strip. Coolest little new mega casino bar around. Great big drinks and hotties all over.   Somehow here I don't feel sleazy talkin' to cougars from Wisconsin. It feels oh so right.

The Foundation Room is the club/lounge on the top of the Mandalay Bay hotel.  This location provides probably one of if not the best views of the Vegas strip in all of its glory.    If you want to have one of those Tony Montana moments where you gaze at the sky and realize that the "world is yours" then all you need to do is go to the Foundation room and gaze below at the Vegas Strip.    Once you are through soaking it in, the Foundation room can be a pretty happening place depending on the day.  We were lucky enough to be invited to a vendor party in a private room that was absolutely beserk and spilled over into the main room once the event ended.    They normally do not charge cover here so if you are at the Mandalay it is definitely worth checking out the view at least and sticking around if the scene is good.

Went to Foundation on a Sunday night and it was  a good time. Everyone was dressed to impress and there were definitely a handful of very beautiful people there. Ages ranged from mid-20's to early 40's. The DJ played a good mix (edm and hip hop). We came at a good time (around 11) and were able to nab a table and couch outside on the balcony. Sweet! If you're staying at Mandalay come up to Foundation for the view and intimate nightlife. :)

This place charged us a $20 cover, then didn't let us in and kept our $20..  I've been ripped off it Vegas plenty of times. But never by a place in high end hotel. Pretty much we show up cause they have ppl handing out their free pass 2 free drink passes. Of course once you get there it's free for women, drinks stop at 12 passes! I kept telling the girls with us the $20 cover for men it's worth it.. the floor guy tells us that he wouldn't lie and it's live up there.  Well I don't know if he lied or not cause security found a vape pen on 1 of us. So he didn't want to let us in and said since we cross the rope entrance that was considered admission for men. Then kept the $20 cover!   In my previous experience any company that does shady business like this obvious has terrible quality and isn't worth go to.

This review is for the RESTAURANT portion of the Foundation Room.  I came here several nights ago for dinner, and it was ok, nothing great. The food isn't bad, but compared to the price, it's not worth it. I guess if you want a quieter place to dine, and you're a member, then sure, it's ok.  I ordered the horseradish crusted, rib-eye steak. Again, it was good, but not great. I would have much rather have had a steak from Mesa Grill.  For sides we ordered the mashed potatoes, and something else, which I can't even remember, that's how insignificant it was.  The service and ambiance are great though. As everyone has pointed out, the view is spectacular. I'd come back for drinks at this particular Foundation Room, and skip the restaurant. Come to think of it, you can just go to Mix, at THE Hotel for drinks and an even better view.  Food: 2 Ambience: 5 Service: 5 Value: 2

The ladies and I came here for some bachelorette celebrating on Saturday night at 11:30pm. A coworker of ours put us on the guest list, so not sure how hard/expensive that would have been to get in. I was a little put off at first by the crowd... wasn't expecting an older, 40ish type crowd, and the area seemed small since there were a few private tables/sections that took up half the space. The view from the balcony was amazing, but too cold for us to stay out there to hang out. Claudeen worked her charm and we were able to walk around and get a tour of the back/VIP rooms thanks also to our boy Ralph. During the tour, we proceeded to meet some friendly brothers and their friends that just wanted to dance and have fun. So of course, we obliged and had a great time... lots of hilarious pictures ensued. We also randomly met Dean Roland from Collective Soul, nice guy and his friends were funny and just enjoying themselves. Unfortunately, I'm not a social butterfly, so I couldn't keep up.  The other nice thing was that the place was carpeted, so wearing heels all night wasn't as painful with the padding. Music was okay, we usually prefer hip hop, but we had a great time either way and got to request a few songs. Most of the guys we met that night were super nice and gentlemenly. I noticed though it seemed like there were more guys than girls. And at least it didn't feel like they were staring. Luckily also, our bachelorette didn't get too weirded out with all the crazy stuff we made her do with them. =P We even had a few cuties help us pick our club for the next night too. Too bad they didn't join us, though. ;)

Very nice, great view and server I think her name was Kelly, nice blonde woman....was very nice.  Enjoyed some nice wine and cheese, the view, relaxation and the soft romantic music from about 6pm till 11, then music turns tekno for a dance club, didn't really get that so left.  Enjoyed entire experience before the new music at 11.

Visited last week, and was disappointed. The bar is really small. There is music but no dance floor to speak of and almost all the seating is outdoors (it was well over 95 degrees that night) and pretty much all of the seating indoors is reserved for bottle service. I have been to similar places before but zero seating? It didn't feel very exclusive and the environment was not very festive. We left and went downstairs to one of the open bars where there was plenty of seating and a dance floor and good musicians. I say if you're going to charge a premium and extra for drinks you need more that a great view to make it feel like an exclusive and special experience.

My steak was PERFECT, my sides were PERFECT.  Service was great, balcony was a greta time, dance floor and crowd was a ton of fun.  If you can get in, you should have a good time.  Grab a Cigar from the small humidor too!

This place was a secret little hideaway. There were statues. Inside there were oversized chairs around the fireplace. There were a couple hidden rooms. The balcony provided a nice view. There was a bar. Very quiet and subtle and fun.

I love this place. It's one of my favorite spots in town.   The food is delicious, with an ever-changing menu; the service is top-notch; the clientele are classy; and the view of the strip is one of the best in Vegas.  The experience truly can't be beat.

Last February, my then girlfriend and I came to Vegas on a Valentine's Day excursion. Our first stop on the first night was the Foundation Room. We went into Mandalay Bay, and were directed into an elevator to the top, where this lounge is located. A former co-worker from Cedars Sinai told me about this place and it's spectacular view. She was not kidding, and I was impressed by what I saw. Check out the pic for the view. The drinks were pretty strong, so I tipped very well in appreciation. The crowd was ok, but not as popping as other Vegas joints. No worries, however, as we were a bit tired from the five hour drive. The indoor portion was ok, it had good music playing and some people dancing. The outside area was better, as I enjoyed the cool fresh air, and the spectacular view. The lighting was pretty good, too, and made for some memorable photos. If you're looking for fast tempo, head elsewhere. For a chill time, come check this place out.

Came here on a Saturday night, they were hosting the after party for Local Brews, Local Grooves. Was instantly rushed by a promoter into the VIP entrance for free, with 3 free drink tickets and put on a fast elevator to the top of the world. The second I got up there the security and staff were all smiles and very helpful. Clean bathrooms and sweet attendants. Bar tender would make double drinks in the exchange for 2 tickets and they were very nice. I find that most bartenders just try to get through each transaction fast to move on to the next, but here there is a large bar so you do not have to wait and the girls have time to smile and thank you. There were some fun dancy gypsy girls that were very mysterious and would dance around the ENTIRE club, with changing glow balls... it was all very entertaining. There is deff an elegant, indian culture vibe. The music was great, current and 90s pop hop, was great.  now.....  THE VIEW!  Even if you dont want to go to dance and simply just want to grab a cocktail and see the city, this is the place.  Manadalay Bay is home to the best views of the Las Vegas Strip.  Seriously, the view.  Do you believe me yet? GO SEE IT.
Great view, awesome service and one of the most unique night clubs and restaurants in Vegas! The view is a must see!

I will give the disclosure that I'm not a "clubber" but I went with a bunch of girlfriends who were really excited about trying out a club in Vegas. The ambiance is pretty cool and the hosts hanging around Mandalay Bay are very nice and eager to offer free drink tickets to young women. We used our tickets but it was uncomfortably crowded and there is literally nowhere to sit. The men in the club were mostly with other women or were much older (like in their 50s). Our group is about 27 and while we enjoyed the music and the views it was just too much. Bottom line: if you like crowed spaces and dancing this is a fun experience, especially if you are a lady and want the free vodka drinks. If you want to be able to rest at all I'd recommend somewhere else.

Went there for an event and I really enjoyed it! Very sultry bar/lounge.  Passed appetizers and open bar. Extremely sultry and very sexy is the decor.  Amazing view of the strip as well as the city.  Dancers entertain you while you enjoy your evening.

A true five star experience!  The prefect blend of elegance, exclusivity and hospitality.   I recently had the opportunity to dine on a slower Thursday night in one of their private dining rooms. Every aspect of the experience was high quality.   I wholeheartedly recommend taking advantage of any opportunity you may have to visit in the future.
One of the best views in the city! Great drinks awesome food come check it out no membership needed in vegas

Blood, drinks and a Tetanus Shot!!!!  We went to the Foundation Room on Friday the 17th is October for a Neyo Concert After Party.  We got a round of drinks and headed to the balcony to check out the view.  Just as we stepped in to the balcony I got stuck in the foot with something and grabbed my husband.  It was a piece of broken glass that's cut my foot.  Ouch.  I looked down at my feet it was blood all over my sandals.  A bouncer popped up out of nowhere and checked me.  He called for a "Medic" on his headset.  He had to call 2 more times for the "Medic" bye that time it was blood dripping on the floor.  The medic came took my over to a take a seat.  Bless his soul he wasn't prepared for the amount of blood that my foot was dripping.  He had one bandaid, a thing of saline, and a pack of gauze.  The "Medic's"hand was shaking.  I looked at my best friend who is in the medical field to care for my wound.  She pressed on my food to stop the bleeding and to make sure it wasn't any glass in my foot.  She told Bouncer with Gloves, sorry I meant to say the "Medic" to get more gauze and more bandaids.  She cleaned the wound with the saline and bandaged me up.   The Medic got us a round of drinks for the inconvenience but never filled out a incident report.  Later that evening we stopped at our hotels security to get more band aids and gauze because the wound was oozing.  They asked us why we never took pics or had a incident report filled out.
