To be honest we didn't think about it.  My foot hurt and was sore for the rest of our visit which totally sucks since you have to walk a mile inmost hotels in Vegas just to get a coffee.   Now that I am home I was still having issues with my foot so I went to my Dr.  she cleaned the wound which does look like it was getting infected, she gave me antibiotics and a lovely tetanus shot!!!    She asked me why I didn't take pictures of the glass, my foot when it happened and all the blood and my answer was it was all just a accident by irresponsible drinks. They dropped their glass and never told security to clean it up.  The other reason was we were more concerned with stopping the bleeding.  My girlfriends husband was feeling faint since he doesn't do well with blood.  The bleeding was so bad that the white on my sandals were covered in blood.   The bouncers were really nice even though they never filled out a incident report.
The music and ambiance amazing. Very professional crowd. Yet super guy heavy. View is super nice. Also in the other tower is mix similar view just different more casual layout.
Come for some relaxed fun and outdoor views. This place is a little hidden gem and worth taking a look.  Promoters hand out free passes out side the club so take a chance

The security staff is really pretentious and kind of aggressive. I guess they have something that's called VIP restroom break where they escort folks from A to B without giving a shit about pushing or even assaulting other guests! Happened on Saturday and one of the folks in my group got a very nice bruise from security member grabbing and pushing her aside! Fucked up place!

A great venue.   What bothers me about many so-called exclusive clubs is the pretentious staff.   The Foundation Room is a breath of fresh air. From the elevator enterance the staff is classy and professional, not typical vthey are very well dressed and take their jobs seriously without coming across as pretentious d-bags.   Once you get up to the 43rd floor, the staff welcomes you. Everyone is great.   The view us amazing. The decor is reminiscent of a Bordello.    The clientele was diverse, but the majority seemed to be of the Jersey Shore variety.   Not my preferred crowd, but the staff and view alone make me a fan!  I'll have to check out the one at home.

Had a corporate dinner there 2 nights ago. 12 people. Two stars regarding food and table service.  Appetizers were good. Ordered rib eye and it was shite.  All fat and gristle with very little meat.   Short ribs were raved about at our table by a couple of people that ordered them.  They got one persons order wrong and he had to watch us eat while waiting for his NY strip.  Service was not too good.  It was relatively quiet there yet our glasses lay empty for 15-20 minutes before we flagged someone down to order more.  Unacceptable for us raging alcoholics.  Good atmosphere, booze and people watching if that's all you want.  Won't be back very soon for a meal. .

Here for a special dinner, since my wife and daughter had been before.  Not always available to non-members, it's definitely worth a request to get reservations. This was one of the best dinner experiences we have had anywhere.  Before dinner happy hour drinks on porch overlooking the strip - best view anywhere, and great drinks and apps.  Bar inside is clubby feeling, cosy and comfortable.  Dinner room is quiet, classy, and not crowded.  Service was great, with just enough good advice, attention, and courtesy. Four of us had ...lamb shanks (outstanding, with good spice and falling off bone), chicken (tender and tasty), and grouper dish (very nice). Everything was wonderful, highlighted by great selection of reasonably-priced wines by the glass.  Finished with dessert (we had not planned to do, but...), selection of three fresh cookies and scoop of gelato, that was terrific.  I would always try to get back here if in town again; worth every penny!
Our experience at the foundation was very disappointing. The waitress was rude, the food was very over priced. The room was dark and overbearing. The only good thing was the view.
I believe this is one of the greatest places on the strip. The balcony view is amazing, the staff are great, and the decor is fabulous.

If you are a guy, this place is amazing. There are two girls that dance the whole time in almost nothing and they have bodies that would make playboy models jealous! Drinks are average $10 but what can u expect for a place u need to know the right person to get into! The outdoor patio is awesome and offers a great view of vegas.

Huge fan of this place, went there last night. It was packed for Labor Day weekend. So fun, I don't know if every weekend  they do this blackout light thing but it was awesome. Never been before, but it was clear this is the place to be.

Appetizers and drinks on the balcony is a must-do!  The view is great.  Dinner is good. Steaks are adequate.  The lamb chops are tender and tasty. Bacon-wrapped shrimp are terrific. Shrimp and grits are quite good as well.  Sides are big enough to share.

First of all we were on a club tour and had to wait like 45 minutes to get in here when there was like no one inside because of the "fight". Then we finally get in and are having fun For my nieces bachelorette party. Then a guy with bottle service was leaving and tried to give us the rest of his Grey Goose bottle which was super cool EXCEPT for when the lame ass bouncer told us he couldn't and then wouldn't even let us go finish it with him. WTF!!

My review is of the restaurant. The food is pretty good. It's and solid, but not way too spectacular. I had the short ribs with the white bean ragu. Everything meshed well together. It was flavorful. The truffle mac and cheese and the grits, you can really see the butter. The steak was cooked perfectly. However, you're really here for the view. You're on top of Mandalay Bay, and you can see the entire strip from the top.

Formerly an exclusive member-only venue, the Foundation Room is a beautifully decorated, unique, warm, fun, stylish place located at the top of Mandalay Bay. There is a special elevator close to the hotel entrance to access the place. We visited the Foundation Room as a group and invested in bottle service (4 bottles) which I had arranged the previous week. The executive VIP host who helped me set up our party was terrific. He was very friendly, accommodating and did a great job explaining all the details around ensuring our event was super high quality and fun for our group. I didn't feel like their only intention was to take as much cash from me as possible, they seemed legitimately interested in ensuring we had a great time at a reasonable cost. Cheers to social media...they all understand the power of the online review.  The Foundation Room offers a large outside terrace overlooking the strip from a distance, probably 1 of the top 3 views of Las Vegas. During our event, we were assigned our private server and bouncer. Our server was very precise, respectful and kept the drinks flowing, even during some of the group craziness. She wasn't over pouring and being reckless with our high-priced booze. Our bouncer at one point removed some guy from our area (who was trying to sneak drinks from our bottles). He was also available to escort girls in our party to restrooms and basically was available to take care of any unique needs beyond serving drinks. He also ensured one of the girls in our party was ok after she started getting a bit too wasted. He was respectful and handled the situation appropriately without dragging me or the group down.  I'm used to bottle service in Vegas being not as accommodating and certainly more expensive. I'd guess I paid about 30% less than I would have at one of the night clubs (which was not our preference anyway). Our group did want to dance, but we also wanted to relax, be able to speak to each other without yelling and be in an environment that we felt was exclusive and friendly. Our table area had a dance podium in front of it, so when the venue dancers used it, it was somewhat exclusive to us.  I've also been to the Foundation Room with my wife only, without the larger group. Still felt exclusive, exotic, warm and sexy (sounds more appropriate than "romantic") Highly recommend this place. If you're celebrating with a group and want to impress your friends with something different than the usual night club, this is a great choice.
Awesome place!  Loved the view outside -- you get an awesome view of the strip!
Got in with a member, found the crowd to be a little stuffy and on the older side.  Can't argue with the view of the strip from the top of Mandalay. Everyone has to experience this once.

I got the shrimp and grits and it was pretty good!They say that it is spicy, but I did not think it was very spicy. It had more of a smoky flavor, so if you're turned off from it because of the potential spice, don't be. Although it was good it was definitely over priced, but that is to be expected since you're paying for the view and experience.

Spending the weekend at the Four Seasons.  Came to the Foundation Room for dinner and drinks.  Beautiful restaurant and strip view.  Unfortunately, we sat 15 minutes waiting for someone to say hello and take our drink order.  Finally got up and left.  Very disappointing service.

Could be amazing. Came yesterday and they could not offer egg whites. Came at open - 7AM per sign. Some random dude informed us they do not open until 8AM. Shame for their advertising. I'm thoroughly disaponted
Great view of the strip from the balcony drinking Cadillac margaritas..the food not as as good as expected but was okay.

I briefly came here with a friend who was visiting the DJ who was performing that night.  I love the interior design of the whole place. Super unique. Super classy.  I love their outdoor patio/balcony area, set up with VIP couches/tables, and outdoor DJ, and not to mention the gorgeous views of the strip.  Only complaint is that it's really small and cramped. Overall, pretty cool place to lounge or dance if you like small crowds.

We are lucky to have a relative that is a member of the HoB Foundation and we have come to the Las Vegas Foundation Room for dinner and a couple of special shows since 2006.   Like the Foundation Rooms in New Orleans and Las Angeles - the decor is lots of dark wood and comfy places to lounge.  What is different is the view.  They have a wonderful outdoor patio you can access off the lounge or the restaurant.  The restaurant is very subdued with dark wall panels, high ceilings and large windows.  It has a very elegant atmosphere.  The lounge has a dark wood bar with comfortable stools and you can look out to the patio and the great view.  There are several rooms you can relax in, have a private diner, or wander out on the patio to enjoy the view.  The patios are the one place you are allowed to smoke...which can dampen the enjoyment for non-smokers.  They have a good wine list but fairly limited to what they serve by the glass in the lounge.  The drinks are tasty and are the price of most upscale lounges in Vegas.    We have never gotten a bad meal in the restaurant.  You can linger over your meal, because they never seem to be trying to hurry you out and I don't remember the restaurant ever being crowded.  But bring your credit card or winnings from the tables because it is not a cheap meal.  We have also gotten appetizers at the bar.  Nice spot to start out your evening ...especially during the work week because it won't be packed.  And you can't beat the view.  If looking for an interesting spot to share drinks and conversation with friends, enjoy a million dollar view of Vegas and maybe catch a live music performance - this is it.  Looking for a "pick up joint" or a trendy hipster lounge....probably will be disappointed.

The Foundation Room is a great place to grab a drink and look out over the city.  It's dark and sexy, with a great outdoor balcony.  The view is awesome.  You can usually find a promoter handing out drink cards, so use them!  My drinks were strong and I had a good buzz on, just the way I like it.  Crowd seemed chill and the vibe hot.  I'm a fan.

I've been coming here to the Foundation Room since before I moved here 3 years ago. It has the most amazing view of the strip! It has great music for dancing and various special guests (tonight Dizzy Reed from GNR is DJing). Definitely the place to come when visiting Las Vegas!

We headed here on a Friday night after being approached about being added to the guest list. As the guest list line was longer than the general admission line, we hopped into the general admission line instead. With less than a 5 minute wait, our names were checked off the list and we were on our way upstairs. Hint: Being on the guest list doesn't mean you won't wait in line - and possibly a longer than if you weren't on the list. Tip: If you are on the guest list and that line is crazy long, just get in the regular line.  Upon making our way upstairs, we wanted to see the view. The little outdoor area with the view is quite small and way crowded. Perhaps there are some other better areas to the Foundation Room, but we didn't see those. We just saw the little rectangle of a balcony. The music was thunderous, of course. There were reserved / VIP booths along the wall and the ledge. It was a complete wall of people standing between the wall and the ledge. You can't see, let alone appreciate, the view unless you have a VIP booth along the ledge. The standing crowd inhibits all sight of the view.  Needless to say, we found it to be a frustrating and not enjoyable experience. Again, perhaps there's entire areas of FR we missed that are nice and pleasant and have a great view. Perhaps dinner here is outstanding. I still want to come here for dinner. But I won't come here again to hang out on that balcony.

The view of the Strip is incredible, and the drinks were actually good (i.e., not watered down) but the service was slow. The music was good, but no one was dancing because there was a company event going on the night I went. I'd definitely go back to see what it's like when a bunch of business people aren't there acting like they have sticks up their behinds.

I'm a member here so I always take my out of town guests here. Of course everyone knows about the view. The food here could be better for the price, but I guess you don't really come here for the dining experience. If you get table service, you also get a personal attendant to make sure you're having a pleasant time.
The view alone makes this place worth it, it's gets a big packed so I recommend getting bottle service which can be a little pricey but that's Vegas for you, will definitely be returning soon
Service and drinks were lacking. The view was pretty but you can only see it if you're outside, we went here instead of the stratosphere or sky fall lounge and it was okay. The decor is fun.
This place is LIT. Great views at night, good drinks and the bartender (Ryan I think) is a solid dude. They were all working hard and it was a chill environment for being Vegas and all. I'll be back.

unless you want to spend a thousand on a $20 bottle so your girl can sit down or have a place to put her purse,  dont come here.   The bouncer even denied her from taking her shoes off.  Plan on not having room to dance since they have added so many vip couches, everything is a walkway.  Best bet is the lift bar at aria which is chill, has live music and plenty of room.

This place was OFF THE HOOK!  I came here for my birthday one Saturday night after we saw how incredibly long and ridiculous the line for Light was.  I had to make a quick decision, and my cousin's girlfriend suggested Foundation Room.  cover is free for girls and $10 for guys.  It was dark here with candles and low lighting - what I would consider perfect ambiance.  It was similar to the ambiance of a speakeasy but bigger and with louder music and more people.  It was a very intimate setting for a bar and the music was at the perfect volume - loud enough to dance but soft enough to hear conversation and talk.  The outside provided a spectacular view of the Strip, where we ended up doing what seemed like a 1 hour photo shoot.    The night was quite a blur, but EVERYONE in my group of 21 people enjoyed themselves and couldn't stop talking about what a great venue and bar Foundation Room was.  They did kick my brother and cousin out around 1:30 AM, so behave yourselves here.  This was a really cool bar, and I would definitely come here again.  Hopefully I'll remember more next time!
I always had a great time at the Foundation room. The drinks are always great, and the patio has a great view of the strip....check it out, you will like
Food was so-so. Servers were somewhat inattentive. Climate control was a huge issue- fan blowing cool forceful air on diners could not be controlled by onsite staff. I would not go back.

We had supper and drinks at the Foundation Room before the Santana concert at the House of Blues.  The steaks and wine in the dining room were great.  After supper we went over to the lounge for drinks.  We loved the view of the city from the balcony. The atmosphere and décor creates a dark, fun, mysterious vibe. The service was great!

Wife and I had an amazing experience Monday night when we had dinner and drinks. Tried to go back with clients  and nobody was allowed upstairs because a few gents had ecigs, you should make that notice to people before they drive across town for dinner... Massive door guy pretty much made our entire party feel like idiots because we had no clue? We were forced to abandon reservations and go elsewhere. Awful customer service at the door, fantastic  staff and food upstairs, if you can make it!
NO cover, NO line, NO nasty people, and a cool view from the balcony!

Worst club in Las Vegas! Trying to get into the club and bouncer named Roy harassed my group because he was ready for bed... ended up kicking us out because he didn't like being asked if he was ready to see id. Now communication and bad customer service!!!
Carmen is the best. Such an amazing server. We had a great meal and will be back.  Food was great and the manager came by to check on us.
It was 60++ floors up with great views of the city.  DJ was a craftsman with his mixes.  If the was a down side it would be the prices but what club in Vegas worth going to isn't?

I can't say enough about the great experiences we've had here with our 35 and older crowd now 3 times! The view, the bumpin 90's to current hip hop music, the service, the gorgeous servers, dancers, just wow! We work with promotor extraordinaire James Lorenzo for VIP table service and have found the staff on the balcony to be the best in class! Nicole, Paul, Travis, you made our friend's 40th bday event so special with the attention and class only you can provide. Thank you Foundation Room! We'll be back for more fun I'm sure

Foundation room is how you see Las Vegas at one glance !! It is mystic with touch of orient ! Food is amazing and staff are super friendly ! They can even teach you about Mountain's name surrounding the city ! One is called Sofia !! Great place to dine before or after a show at the house of Blues !! Bon Appétit

Two words: douche central.   I had a bad feeling about this place when on the elevator ride up, some dbag was smoking a cigarette, spat on the floor, threw his cigarette down, stomped it out and left it. Note, the dude's girlfriend/date also rudely walked into me and didn't apologize. Classy.  Yes, they have a nice view from their balcony, but I was too suffocated by the hookah smoke (ha, didn't realize that people still DID that!) and blocked by the heads and bodies of the unattractive patrons to enjoy it. (My thinking is, if you're going to be an annoying douchebag, at least be attractive, right?!) Even though it was a $20 cover for my boyfriend to get in there (total rip off!), we left after one round of terribly overpriced drinks (I want to say it was like 45 bucks for a jack and coke and a grey goose/tonic). Just a gross place, avoid it.

Great place to get the BEST view of the Vegas Strip and offers great drinks to boot. The balcony views are great and add to romance of an evening with a date and friends. Food: have never had a bad meal. Service impeccable and again the views. Try the Steak and the Lobster Mac-N-Cheese  great wine selection and  great drinks. Enjoy! Enjoy!

My boy D and I hit up Foundation Room after a long day of work and sightseeing.  We were just looking for a relaxed vibe and a drink or two.    Luckily I had a connection to get us on the list, so can't really comment on cover costs.  The bouncer at the bottom of the elevators was cool to us and we got in pretty quickly.  FR was actually smaller than I thought it was going to be, but then again I think there may have been some other (private?) rooms that just weren't open the night we went.  The VIP couch areas take up a good amount of floor space in the main bar area (especially if people are dancing in the free space).  But the view is great from the balcony and the drinks aren't too expensive.  For the most part I enjoyed the crowd.  A couple of groups in the VIP couch areas who seemed to be having fun and were an attractive crowd.  A handful of cougars on the prowl, and your complement of single guys and gals with their eyes constantly scanning the crowd.  The decor is very Zen with a large Buddha guarding the entrance to the club once you step out of the elevators and some great wall decorations.  The combination of serene decorations and mellow music made for an enjoyable couple of hours.  I'd recommend people to check it out.  It's not wild and crazy like some other Vegas clubs, but that's part of the reason why I liked it.   More low key, mellow, loungey, than your typical over-the-top Vegas style club.  Most people probably wouldn't want to spend their entire night here, but it is definitely good for a couple of hours.

My favorite place to go. Great food at reasonable prices, as well as drinks that are very well made. friendly staff. Great atmosphere! My favorite dish I think would be shrimp and grits.  But its all good. Balcony view is AMAZING. It isn't so loud you can't here anyone. It does become more night clubish after 10.

If you likd the long lines, steep cover charges, over crowded dance floor, and over priced drinks....well this place isnt for you!  This is a more mellow atmosphere with little or no lines, cover was only $20 for guys on a Friday & Sat night I was their, and chill crowd.  Everyone talks about how amazing the view is at the top, and its just that!...AMAZING! The view alone is worth it.

You can't beat the view and the relaxed environment. Also, Probably the best Mac and cheese I've ever eaten in my life. Service is exactly what would be expected for a fine dining restaurant. I'm really glad they sat my boyfriend and I next to a window. The view was worth every dollar of the $215 tab for my boyfriend and I.

Didn't know this lounge existed until my wife and I happened by the entrance one evening. We had just returned from dinner at the Eiffel Tower and we're looking for a night cap. It was early (9pm) so they waived the cover and took us up the private elevator to the lounge on top of Mandalay Bay. Cocktails were around $12 but they offer bottle service with bottles north of $2000. Definitely one of the nicest places we visited this trip.

I spent this past Saturday night (my 30th birthday) at The Foundation Room at the top of The Mandalay Bay.    I couldn't have asked for a better way to spend my 30th.  It's a member's only place, but somehow my best friend made arrangements in advance for a group of 8 of us to go.  It was such a great time!  The interior decor is stunning, it's cozy yet not crowded, the crowd is just out to have a good time (not typical Vegas cheesy or pretentious), the view is unbelievable, and the dancing and music were just perfect.  I had such a wonderful time here.  Next time I go to Vegas, I definitely want to head back.  This was by far my favorite spot during the weekend.

I ate there recently and discovered they changed a few things on their menu. Didn't try everything new but did get the tuna bruschetta, very good. My steak was good too, but the highlight was their new flourless chocolate cake. Wow!  Can't wait to try that again.

Great place. Service was solid, atmosphere unique and the drinks great priced for the Strip and location at about $10 each. Have been to many 'ultra-lounges" and this is perfect. Before 10pm, mellow, and relaxing, that after about 11pm kicks up. Security is great and issues never seem to happen. Dinner is great, excellent food, and best Strip views in Vegas. Way better than being trapped in a bubble looking at building sides as you go around in a circle.
The ambiance is really good and the bar food is amazing. The bar has an outside patio from where you can have a nice glimpse of the whole strip.

YES, YES, AND MORE YES for Foundation Room!!   This was our 3rd stop on our VIP UNLTD club crawl (see review) and boy, was I impressed. The venue itself is on the smaller side, with VIP seating in the middle that had a sort of "living room" feel. The music was excellent, playing a mix of hip-hop, pop, radio hits, and EDM. Drinks were definitely on the pricier side though, with a shot of simple Fireball whisky costing $10. I decided to go down to Evening Call for my discounted drinks that night, lol.   The view of the strip from the small outside balcony is BREATHTAKING. They say this is arguably the best and most complete view of the Strip in all of Vegas. You look to your left and you're literally right next to the shiny, golden lettering on the hotel that reads "Mandalay Bay". Pictures and descriptions don't do it justice.   I will definitely be back to the Foundation Room, especially if I want to hit up a smaller, slightly more chill spot after a long night of clubbing at places larger and more amped up. 5 stars, baby!

Am I not remembering this place correctly? The view was spectacular from the outside patio, the drinks were delicious and moderately priced for Vegas, and the bartenders were cute.   But the music, oh the music. Nelly videos don't really seem "high-end club" appropriate. The decor is so beautiful and so zen, and the music is about Bentleys and hos. The juxtaposition is more jarring than welcomed.   The crowd was also very, very strange. There seemed to be a bar crawl of foreigners who's idea of hitting on a girl was to tell her that she's tall. Before that were a group of middle aged couples getting freaky to Missy Elliot on the dance floor. It's an interesting time and worth the visit if you don't have to pay a cover.

This place is very nice. It's not crazy crowded and the people who get up there are not ghetto at all. The riff raff seems to be weeded out. You can sit outside and enjoy this incredible view of the strip or hang out inside. Plenty of good drinks everywhere. I love making it a point to visit this room whenever I'm in Vegas.  If you have a Platinum MLife card, you automatically get to enter for free.

Hello Everybody, my husband and I had a great time again at the Foundation Room at Mandalay Bay again this year and was there last year too.  Foundation Room keeps getting better and always has great surprises and best costumes people with happy and smiling faces and great manners and very courteous staff.  We ate at the restaurant and never fails great front row views of Vegas.  So pleased and didn't get charged this year as I had our name on the Guest List.   Next year hope to be there again.  Maria C. Henderson,NV.

Very professional establishment. Had bottle service and the waitress always kept coming  around to make sure we were ok, security took care of us all night making sure no one was sitting in our booths that wasn't supposed to be. TIP your waitress and security generously!!! The DJ was killing it with old school 90's hip hop.. My group could not get off the dance floor!!! Awesome time!!!!

This Review is just for the bar/lounge. Normally it is $30 a person to go up to the foundation room but we got free passes through my vegas. You have to go to the house of blues gift shop first to get the actual vouchers. Then you go to the four seasons elevator area to he admitted. Once you get to the top & into the lounge it has interesting decor & low key vibe. There are couches & a bar area inside but most people are out on the balcony to see the best view on the strip.   Since mandalay bay is at the south end of the strip, you get a full northbound view of the strip from high up. It's fantastic.  The drinks are pricey , but in the vegas norm.

Top of the hotel? Exclusive? Great view? Let me in, already!  The elevator to the Foundation Room is closed off and you need a reservation or else they won't let you in. Rode up to the top uninterrupted and was ready to chow down right away.  After getting out of the elevator, I couldn't help but gag at the decor in this place. It screams old boys club (which is what it was originally). However, for the amount of hype this place builds, I was hoping for such much more! Not some tacky, gaudy restaurant.   And I have a pretty sensitive nose, so maybe it's just me but the place has a very distinct scent to it... which I'm not sure I was loving.  We're seated right away -- mostly because the entire place was dead with the exception of one other party. Servers were prompt and helpful with our every need. Then again, for the price I was about to pay for dinner... I expected no less.  I ordered the baked scallops while my boyfriend ordered a new york strip steak. We both decided to share the yukon mashed potatoes.   I'm salivating at the thought of the juicy baked scallops and can't wait for them to come. I'm expecting something savory and delicious. I wanted something that would stamp out my hunger and leave me satisfied.  When they came, I was obviously excited.  HOLY SALT! I nearly spit my first bite of the scallop out of my mouth. I couldn't believe how salty it was. YUCK.  Boyfriend's steak looks delicious. I wish I had ordered it. He obviously chows down with no issues.  Our yukon mashed turned into another salty side platter of herb baked potatoes. Not sure how yukon mash turns into baked potatos, but okay. They were salty as hell.  All in all, food was NOT worth it.   The view? FABULOUS.   Overall, never going again. You can get much better meals and experiences at other Vegas restaurants.

Best place to come check out the view of the strip. Great music, zen-like ambiance, and friendly staff. Per the usual in Vegas, if you're a girl, entrance is most likely free. Prepare to pay $10-$20 if you're coming with your guys.   I went with 2 customers, so we went outside a couple of times to chat without trying to yell over the loud music inside. Highly recommended...this place never disappoints.

The last thing I ever expected from the House of Blues was to be surprised.  I consider HOB to be pretty predictable and it definitely isn't a place that I'd consider for any type of nightlife outside of a concert.    Enter:  The Foundation Room.    This place is pretty cool.  It has a hookah lounge meets Morocco meets Bourbon Street vibe (w/ the outdoor patio).  It's eclectic and intimate and I'd love to go back again, order a bottle of Pinot and a cheese plate and just pretend like I'm hanging out somewhere 3000 miles away.

The view was absolutely stunning. But that was the highlight. The night I decided to go here it was extremely packed! Could barely get a very expensive drink and only to find out it was not what I ordered. The music was pretty good but it was so packed you couldn't really dance. It was an experience but I don't think I would return.

The balcony is EVERYTHING! The DJ was pretty good, they played a great variety of music. Hard to get the bartenders attention unless you're waving money. Was able to get on the guest list and had free champagne and well drinks til 12am! The club is a little on the smaller side.

The view is breathtaking. Was a bit small, but could have been because it was a Sunday. Perhaps, they close off a few area.   The elevator ride was short, so it was perfect for those who are claustrophobic.

Foundation Room, located at the top of the Mandalay Hotel this place gets an extra star for the views. You can honestly see the entire strip from up here. There is an exclusive elevator strictly for the restaurant and you will not be allowed up unless you have a reservation.  I booked a table for a couple of my friends birthdays. The decor is what you would expect from an exclusive gentleman's club...think old money. Once seated, the servers are attentive to you. This is what you would expect at these prices. Think of the Foundation Room as a place you would take your best friends, clients or significant other. You should dress up as its a club that requires jackets.  The food is a higher quality and the taste was great. To compliment the food we had bottles of wine. Yes, the pairing was great and lets just say that it was the start of a fun night out.  Ive heard that some nights this restaurant turns into a club. I havent been here when it has  but Im assuming its a lounge style to enjoy the great views.

Now this review may be slightly skewed and I'll explain why.  You see I've been a Member of the Foundation Room for a number of years.  I frequent my local one in Texas regularly.  With that in mind the Foundation Room here in Vegas didn't disappoint!!!  The concierge, host desk, bartenders and wait staff were all excellent!  My party and i were well taken care of and we were quite happy with everything overall.

This is hands down my favorite place in Las Vegas to soak in all the decadence of the city! The best nights to go are Thurs-Saturday and I believe that it's always free for ladies, perhaps before a certain time? I'd call before just to double check that they are open since I'm pretty sure they're closed some week nights. This club/lounge feels super special as you must get in the elevator and press the special 'foundation room' button to get there. The doors open and you enter a heaven 64 floors open above the city. It is soaked in deep, dark colors with lots of buddhas and Asian feeling statues and decorations everywhere. It feels very worldly and exotic.  The ambience is a perfect blend of lounge and club with a dj playing dance music but it's not so big that you lose your friends or get a headache from the decibel levels. The main room has a large bar and leads you to the big outside patio. The view is unbelievably beautiful and so intoxicating. It's a great blend of all types of people and not just overrun with 20 somethings like sole of the mega clubs are. After going there a half dozen times I actually stumbled upon a small room in the back playing EDM.  It felt like a secret party and was so much fun! This place is the absolute best!

So, my boyfriend and I came here the week of Christmas...we were pretty disappointed.    Maybe it was that it was dead because of said holiday.   Maybe it seemed lame and sad because there were only 2 families out on the balcony and 2 couples there to take pictures against the impressive backdrop.    Maybe it was the sad go-go dancer, dancing up a storm while nobody paid attention, or maybe it was that there was nobody really around to pay attention.   I dunno.  I just know that it seemed really desperate and really boring while we were there.  I'm sure that on nights where it's packed, it's a much better atmosphere, but, damn.  It wasn't on that night.   Having just spit out all that negativity, I will say that they gave very generous pours, especially for Vegas standards, and that the view from the balcony is worth your time.   Maybe I'm just getting old and don't appreciate these places anymore, but I highly doubt it.

This is a must visit for the view. The club itself was pretty fun and prices were reasonable for the location. The reason for not having 5 stars was that security kept blaming for everything that wasn't happening. I heard several people blamed for throwing stuff off the balcony and nothing like that was happening at all. Invest in some better cameras if you're going to blame people for things.

I loved everything about this restaurant.  It is located on the 67th floor of Mandalay Bay.  Our waiter was really attentive and checked on us frequently.  I ordered the filet mignon with chimichurri sauce, and it was REALLY good.  If you are a fan of mac n cheese, then I highly recommend getting the truffle mac n cheese.  I probably could have eaten a big bowl of that.  There is a patio that overlooks the strip,  go take pics on the patio.

4 stars for a good view of the strip and 3.5 stars for food. Some dishes were great and others were a miss. One guy in our group did not receive his entree for a very long time which they did remove from the bill. For the prices here, such a long delay is unacceptable.

Great view. Disappointing food. Service was not up to par as expected for the price point. Minor details makes a big difference.   My drink was knocked over and glass was broken, took a long time to replace. Had to waited to steak knife only to find out steak was over cooked. Sent back and waited another long time while others are done with their food.   Steamed clams was overly salty. Crab cakes were dried. Overall, it was not worth the money in a competitive dinning environment like Vegas. Probably great for drinks but won't be back for dinner.
3 rooms, great views,  outdoor lounge from the top of Mandalay bay. Fun. A slightly older crowd (eg 30/40ish), but perfect for me.
It was an interesting experience but as a locsl there was a lot to be desired. Happy hour was a bait and switch and service was awful

We went for dinner before MJ's One. We were on a time crunch and the staff accommodated us wonderfully. The view of the strip was great and so was the food. A member in my party had the lamb, she needed to get the bad lamb taste from another Vegas restaurant off her palate, she said the lamb was excellent. I had the scallops and it was one of the best I've had.  I'm coming back next time I'm in town and would recommend this place to friends and family.

Food is great, drinks are great, staff was great, and Sirius Chill sets the mood.  Dark and romantic.  The view is spectacular. We went early, nice crowd, but not too crowded.  No cover before 10pm. Best lounge we've been to in 14 years of visiting Vegas.  Truffle Mac & Cheese is crazy!!! Just go already:)

Very laid back lounge with a diverse crowd. I would say the crowd is a little on the older side unlike the typical younger crowd you see at the hottest nightclubs on the strip. The dancers here are less skanky and more elegant. They range from belly dancers to seductive dancers with peacock costumes and led lights. Some of the dancers are often on the dance floor dancing alongside with you! You will also get a very nice view of the strip and Mandalay bay from the patio.

We went to the Foundation Room for a friends 50th birthday.  It was scheduled through a promoter who greeted us at the elevator.  We had a group of 10 people. The promoter escorted us up to the lounge. Our table wasn't ready and we had about a 15 minute wait. We headed to the balcony which really was the only reason that this review received any stars.  It was dark and the decor was a little trashy.  Wires hanging from exposed outlets etc.  we were finally seated and had to wait for quite som time for menus and service.  Our friend, the guest of honor, asked if he could order a drink, the server said yes and walked away.  The food was ok but for the price should have been better.  The servers were rude and not very attentive.  The bus boy was probably the only one that was doing his job.  They brought out the wrong meals and then got upset when we told them it wasn't what we ordered.  I'm sure if you are only going for cocktails it's fine but the rest was not worth it.

Great atmosphere and great music!  It's a lounge/club for adults...   it's like a club but it's not...  seemed like a little older crowd... (we were celebrating our friends 40th birthday) and we fit in, definitely a range of age but not the bodycon 21 year olds.... we had table service inside, I thought was perfect and the service was great.  It was fun to dress up, dance,  and hang with your friends!  Inside was great because they had dancers/belly dancers and room to dance.  Outside was a spectacular view, but as you would imagine crowded, but easily accessible and could move up and down fairly quickly.

Nina Quincy is THE most amazing person!! She met us and took us in and showed us an.amazing time!! She shared with us some of the history of the foundation room, had our table ready and waiting on us, she kept in contact with us the entire night to make sure we were comfortable and we were taken care of. We couldn't have asked for a more wonderful time. Fantastic views of the strip!

Went with a member this last time on a Saturday night. It was not very crowded, but most or probably all of the tables were not bussed and overflowing with dirty dishes...  Once made aware, they did come out and partially clean one small table.  The bar was not very busy, but the bartenders did a good job making themselves look busy and not being very helpful. After being ignored by the bartenders for about 10 min we left. The member we were with did register a valid complaint. This is the third time having not so great service in this place. It is kind of a running joke for us now!  Kind of a cool atmosphere though.
We just went to this place for the first time tonight. I will recommend it to my friends.

After the Michael Jackson show on a Monday we went up to the foundation room for some drinks... I got one free drink ticket but when I got to the bar they were out of champagne so I settled with vodka cranberry which by the way had more cranberry than vodka... I ordered a second drink with cash and it had a bit more vodka... The lighting is very dim the DJ was playing songs from back in the 2000s it was not very packed the Decor was antique rugs on the floor a fireplace ...the crowd was also older about 40's and up . They also have a good outside view but there's not a lot of seating .
I mean you're coming here for the view right?  I mean that part is worth it.

Some dude handed us a voucher for free entry into the Foundation Room and two complimentary drinks. The view is amazing. Somehow our two complimentary drinks turned out to be $22 for a glass of wine and $6 for a well drink. I guess they do math differently here in Vegas.

We were in awe of the venue and the gorgeous view overlooking the city at night!  However, I must say, the foods were over-rated and a bit salty.    We ate our foods and enjoy each other's company nevertheless.  But what happened at the end was the last straw for me!!  WORSE customer service ever!!  Anthony, our server, took forever to fill our orders and kept forgetting to bring us what we requested.  Didn't bother to check up on us to see if we need anything or how the foods were to our tasting!!  For a party of 9 we altogether sampling roughly 15 items on the menus... Let's just say that we were left VERY disappointed!  When the bill came, we saw a few extra items and inquire on these extras. The items in questions were not ordered or served to us.  He then said there was a drink that came out but he forgot to add it to the bill and took the bill saying he needed to add the 'drink' to the bill but will comp it on the house.  We got a revised bill for more than our meals plus the 18% gratuity because he unilaterally chooses the amount of gratuity for himself on top our bill!!  Seriously??  I never expected such type of 'bait and switch' tactic from this restaurant!

Honestly the food was 4.5 stars. The atmosphere is horrible. They had us wait on the outdoor patio until our table was ready. It was DISGUSTING. Filthy dirty chairs, stained, and food mashed in. The menus were sticky and dirty. I wouldn't even sit on the chairs with my dress clothes. The actual restaurant was creepy. Buddha decor, very dated carpet and chairs from the 60s.  The food and service was good except for the aloof hostess. Not friendly at all. And the whole ritual to get in to the place looks like something out of a gangster movie.

Love the professional girls dancing on the tables. Great view of the strip, all lit up at night.   Neat rooms.  Cramped space though. And it depends on what night you go. Music can be hit or miss. As can the crowd.

Maybe I went at a bad time or on a bad night, but I couldn't wait to ditch the place for something more enticing. The crowd was too old, the music wasn't getting any reaction (meaning no dancing), and I can't believe this place is members only... I would never pay. If you like a stiff, older crowd then check it out :)
Very nice place to have a private party! The club itself is very nice for people of all ages. I think they could do better with DJ's. I was there the Saturday before Memorial Day.

What a great time we had! The entire staff from the greeter down stairs to the hostesses and wait staff were top notch. The food was out of this world good!! My wife got the NY strip and I got the long bone short rib that was so tender didn't need a knife.   Afterwards we went to the patio where we had a great view of Vegas.

I used to be a member, and I think it's seen it's better days. It's not very exclusive when they hand out passes to everyone who walks into the casino. Now, it just seems old and a bit beat up. It used to be the place I wanted to go. Now, it's just the place I go if (insert club here) is too crowded. As for the food, it's Vegas. You can do better (and pay less). It still is probably the best view in Vegas, and if you can afford the New Years Eve party, it's unforgettable. It was great when you could watch the HOB shows live in the media room.  Go for drinks on the patio, but not for any other reason.

Through some good fortune I am a Foundation Gold member this year which has allowed me the opportunity to eat at the restaurant and hang out at the club more often.  Restaurant: They changed their menu from the last time I dined here. It is now based around small plates and appetizer size foods. A la carte meats and cheeses, oysters, and other treats. They have a few large items that I have not tried yet. My wife and my dining plan is usually to try a bunch of small stuff and share.  In an age where restaurants seem to be cutting back on the size and diversity of bread baskets, this one is wonderful. Four types of bread and a trio of butter. The short rib with spicy kimchi is unique and tasty, and spicy. The chicken lollypops are chicken wings elevated with two delicious sauces. The pork and prawns which lacks any discription on the menu is two large bacon wrapped shrimp and a slaw. Can't really go wrong with something wrapped in bacon.  My only real problem is that my oysters seemed to be shucked with a hammer. They were very fresh and tasty, but there were substantial shell bits in most of them. On a related note, I was at a party in the lounge that was serving food and the shrimp pot pie I had (although very good, and in the cutest little cast iron skillet you've ever seen) was also full of shell. Keep an eye on the prep work guys and I'll be happy.  The Club: I'm kind of like an old person here. I don't go here late very often when the DJ is going and it has more of a club feel. It is a great place for the view and it's nice to bring people from out of town up here for a little bit different experience. Most of the time the bartenders are very cold and not too worried about you. The drinks are a couple dollars more than downstairs at Mandalay Bay, but the 20% off member discount helps. They also hand out 2-for-1 coupons in the casino that are good for well drinks and domestic beers that help out with the cost as well.

Amazing amazing..food was the best I had the whole trip  and you  can't beat the view. At night it turns into a night  club and they had an open champagne bar for  the ladies. Which we took advantage of and loved. This place was so much fun but the  only downside  is its a little small.
I LOVE the bar!!!  The decorations are amazing!  The view is incredible!  I try to go here whenever I'm in Vegas

What a great view of the strip!  Our cocktails were very tasty, but we did not stay too long.....We were the only people there at opening, so it was not too exciting due to that.  However, I will go back again to enjoy the amazing view.

The view the view the view. That's what everyone says about this place. It was really easy to get into - i.e. no line. A lot of the people there on the inside dancing seemed older the night that we went. I kind of got this dirty old man vibe from the sausage party lining the corners of the dark inside area.  We made our way out to the legendary viewing deck. And it was smaller like a tiny apartment balcony. So tiny. Part of it was roped off to some VIP tables which made it seem probably smaller than it was.   The view is nice up there - if you are tall enough to see it over everyone's heads. People were clustered like beans in a can so tightly, trying to take so many pictures. There was barely any room. I'm just glad I was wearing 5 inch heels so I could actually see a bit. If you are a shorty, FORGET IT. You will see nothing unless you ride on someone's shoulders. Then you'd probably fall off the edge because there isn't much of anything besides a ledge up there. Don't do it. If you're drunk, you'll fall and it's high up.   We took a picture and left.

Best meal of my life!  Some friends of ours are members and made reservations for the four of us for dinner last month.  Upon taking the elevator ride, we were escorted to a private room that was dimly lit and well-decorated with an Indian flair and a fantasic view of the back of the strip.  Soft music played in the background as we sat down on cushy-comfy couches.  Our friend had formed a friendship with the mater'd and we were treated like royalty.  We enjoyed two bottles of their newest champagne (served in wine glasses with ice and mint leaves), enjoyed the tiger shrimp wrapped with bacon as a appetizer, and took photos.  For dinner I had the roasted chicken while hubby enjoyed rack of lamb.  It was his first time eating it and said it was amazing.  I tried a bite and it was!  Our friends ordered several sides including truffled mac n cheese, which I tried and enjoyed.  I was very satisfied with the meal.  After dinner we went out to the bar and ordered drinks.  While the men drank whisky, us ladies enjoyed a drink new to me: pineapple upside down cake (in a double).  So good!   We went out to the balcony which offered a gorgeous view of the strip and "front row" seats to the Avenged Sevenfold concert playing across the street.  By far, my night at Foundation Room was the best night in a long time :)  PS.  It was really cool to see the private lockers of some of my favorite celebs!  Too bad the night didn't grant me a sight of the actual person.

My friends and I purchased one of the VIP Bar tours.  This bar was on the list of clubs.  It was the first stop on the list, and the best part about it is the view.  Amazing balcony view from the top of Mandalay Bay.  That definitely makes it worth the trip.  However, do NOT think you will be dancing here.  They do not allow cameras in the club itself.  It is very dark, with dark wood panelling and dark wood bar.  Dimly lit.  There are lounging chairs and couches, and two go-go dancers that dance on small platforms.  Although we enjoyed a good drink, we witnessed that security would approach any customers that were dancing and ask them to stop.  Only the go-go dancers can dance.  The customers just stand around, or lounge on couches.  So, go, take some great pictures outside on the balcony, and then leave.  I will not be going back.

Wanted to check this place out for the raving comments about the view, so my boyfriend and I ventured to this place to take a peek after dinner.  LOCATION: There are no signs directing you to the Foundation Room as you're walking around in Mandalay Bay. Elevators are located on the backside of the guest elevators and right in front of the escalators that lead you to the pool/beach.  INSIDE: You take an elevator to go to the top and once you get there, the place is pretty dark. The restrooms are right next to the elevator. There's a section for dining in, but we just walked over to where the bar and balcony was. There was plenty of seating (I think) but the place was so packed, we didn't want to stay. Can get a little claustrophobic if there's a crowd.  BALCONY: View is pretty nice! Smoking is allowed outside on the balcony, so if you're not comfortable with that - don't stay out there so long.  We took in the views, took some pics and headed back down. Maybe we'll come back and check this place out again another time?

Well, I can't comment on the food, as I only went for a late-evening round of drinks (which I think turned into 5 or 6 rounds...).    The place is definitely cozy and welcoming, and while I'm not sure of the guestlist situation, the fellow at the elevator just nodded at us as our group announced itself and ushered us right in.    As it was the middle of the week, the place was pretty calm and not overrun by pretentious twits, which was just perfect by us.  Good drinks with an excellent selection, and a bartender that also sold us cigarettes and cigars made it very difficult to want to leave.  From the Buddha at the top of the elevator to the Strip in all of its (lurid?) glory, the views here are worth the trip.

Go for the view. That's about it. I'm not into clubs but I can deal with lounges (I'm too old for either of those scenes, really). But, I could see this being a decent place to hang if you're with a good group. The balcony area is decent but can get crowded quickly and there are only a few places to sit. Inside you can sit if you want bottle service. They've also got a few rooms that were roped off... I guess for bottle service also. The bartenders were quick and friendly and there were some decent go-go dancers. The crowd was a bit older -- upper 30's and up. If you really want to head up to the 60-whatever floor to see the view, go ahead. Take a pic, admire the strip, get a few drinks, hang for a bit, and head somewhere else.

We stopped by for a couple drinks and a cigar to check out the views.They are some of the best in town.We had to go inside to ask for someone to come out to take our drink order.They sent out a gal named Sasha who acted like she was doing us a favor.When we asked to bring our tab to cash out we noticed she had added someone's shooters to our bill which we pointed out and she quickly admitted to the mistake.Drinks are already high to begin with,so make sure to check your bill thoroughly when going up there.

Ehh, tries to pass off as a high end spot but the atmosphere wasn't right and the music had everyone kinda standing around hoping the next song would be better. Plus the bouncers were whack, they'd harass anyone tryna check out the club from the outside. Dope view for pictures once you get to the top tho.

Very pleasant place for a date night! Excellent food in the restaurant or appetizers in the patio and bar area.. Nice relaxing decor and live DJ .. The view from the balcony is unparalleled in Vegas..  We like to go on week nights to avoid complete craziness and we go early..

My company funded a cocktail hour here recently, which I got to attend. The view is SPECTACULAR. The atmosphere is cozy and comfortable. The little beef wellington hors d'uvre were delightful. The bartender made this drink... he didn't give it a name... that was like a glass of happiness.   Yeah. Go there.

I had my doubts even though there are so many reviews and a high rating I really was expecting the worst, I was wrong.    We had dinner with a business associate and his wife and she really wanted to try it so of course we will say yes even though we had low expectations.  It was last minute and the night of Santana opening up his show but they fit us in in the time frame we wanted without a problem.  Because it was Santanas opening they had to make accommodations for more seating.  We lucked out and were seated in one of the nightclubs VIP rooms.  So we had our own private room with amazing decor and large extremely comfy couches!    We ordered our drinks and began looking over the menu which is large and has a lot of options to try depending on your tastes.  Our friends had Shrimp and Grits and 8oz Center Cut Filet.  The shrimp and grits were good he enjoyed them but wished for more flavor in it, the steak was done to perfection she enjoyed her meal as well.  My Boyfriend had the Seared Diver Scallops that he said were done perfectly not a bit of rubbery feel to any of them.  I had the Mediterranean Sea Bass, with yukon potatoes, fennel slices assorted olives and a lemon vinaigrette.  My fish was left moist but firm the mixture of the olives and lemon vinaigrette made the mixture of the flavors stand out in my mind.    I definitely recommend a dinner here if you are looking for a great view great ambiance and great food and service.  I will be back...

Very disappointed with dinner. My wife and I went on a Monday evening, very slow night. We started with the crab cakes....they tasted store bought. I would not recommend them. The short ribs lacked flavor.

I have been to the Foundation Room numerous times over the years while visiting Vegas and Mandalay Bay. It is quite a large area as there are many rooms you can sneak off too, provided you are on the VIP list or possibly know the right people. The view of the strip is awesome and that is what most people come up here for. The cost of drinks are quite steep, but it is Vegas and it is the Foundation Room, but just be prepared. It would be a great date night for you and the special someone, especially on the slower nights which are usually Tuesday/Wednesday.

At times it's great, and other times it just felt odd. Some of the workers (especially in the restaurant) are just socially awkward. They said there is a dress code, but it didn't seem to be enforced. They let up guys in jeans, hoodies, and baseball hats, which really killed the vibe (since we were dressed pretty nicely). The opening DJ on Tuesday, December 29 was TERRIBLE. I asked a few of the servers when Kay the Riot was going to start and they had no idea.  All that aside, the food is great, the drinks are great, and the workers in the lounge are friendly. If they would've enforced the dress code I would've given it a higher rating.

The Foundation Room is located at the very top of the Mandalay Bay Resort & Casino. I loved the place, very classy and upscale. The lounge itself is very good with great atmosphere and music. Balcony area is probably the best place to view the lights of the Vegas Strip. Beautiful views and the perfect place to take a picture.   We have visited The Foundation Room several times in the past and it never gets old. This time around we were out there for a conference and had an invite for the private party. I'd not recommend paying for a cover charge to get in though. Best to go to Mandalay late afternoon and get onto the guest list - which also includes free entry and 2 free drinks for the ladies. We also noticed that there were people inside the casino handing out free passes for promotion during the day.
I love the decor here the private rooms and the view out the balcony thats all I remember it was worth the decor alone.

This place is hands down, the BEST lounge I've ever been to. I'm not saying that just in the Vegas vicinity alone....I'm comparing this place to all the other lounges I've been to anywhere else in the world.   Okay..that's subjective, I've only covered three continents out of six. The seventh doesn't count for obvious reasons unless I'm trying to break some sort of record. Top Gear South Pole, anyone?  This lounge knows classy. The management and the founders behind this place know what's tasteful in terms of decor, and they know what kind of crowd they're catering to.   When you walk in right after exiting the elevator to get up here (rooftop of Mandalay Bay. If you watch a lot of music vids, you've seen this place) you'll notice a very impressive looking Buddha statue. Ask any of the hostesses about the story behind it!  The cocktails here are made VERY well. There are go-go dancers in the center room, and you can land a table or a private room with advanced reservations. They also have an awesome cigar menu at lounge prices (a little more expensive than a typical cigar lounge).  Probably the most breathtaking part of this lounge aside the decor and the vibe of the place is the view you get here that you just can't get anywhere else on the strip. Walk outside to the patio where you can see the entire strip and its lights at night from the south end all the way up to the north.  I've made this lounge my go-to spot for all my friends and our Saturday nights.   If you and your friends are tired of the archaic waiting, prices, and crowd of night clubs, and would like to try something new, swing by FR. You can find the entrance next to the elevators at Mandalay Bay.

A lounge where we couldn't lounge because all the chairs were roped off....  Came here with a group of friends on a Friday night. The promoter told us that all girls would get in for free and will receive drink tickets. He also mentioned that the boys will have to pay $20 but not to worry as it comes with free drinks - lies!!! Our boys paid their fee but never got free drinks.   Ambiance: lively and poppin but crowded. It was set up like a lounge but since there was no way you could sit unless you paid at least $800 you have no other option than to stand on the walk path. People were dancing on the pathways so it was like a club with not dance floor. The outside area is the same. There's a nice view but good luck squeezing in there to take a picture of the view.   Drinks: the drink tickets were for a bubbly champagne or a vodka drink. They serve it in a small cup with lots of ice. I was surprised as to how much vodka flavor was in my cranberry vodka. Others would probably feel like, " yes they hooked it up with the alcohol" but It didn't taste right. Drinks were ridiculously priced.  No video recording... No video... No recording... No 15-second Instagram footage. FYI. I kept getting caught trying to film my friends and I having fun. That rule was a bit odd.  Can someone explain to me why the security/bouncer guys have to get my attention by lightly pinching the inner part of my arm?! Gross! Please don't touch me. Tap my shoulders. That would have been more respectful.  Overall, not my scene. If I wanted to go to a club I would go to a club... Not a lounge such as this... But I wanted to go to a lounge... and this lounge did not meet my expectations. I usually have problems with other costumers and their etiquette. Unfortunately this time, its the service and staff that disappointed me.  I suggest going elsewhere.
Is it worth the hassle.. Once there your trapped.. So a view,, once is enough..
Came here for a party.   The lounge had a lot of comfortable seating.   The balcony had a great view of the strip.   The bartenders are heavy handed with their drinks.

Walked into the elevator and go straight to the top, you will step out and instantly feel wicked sexy ;-) This isn't a club, it's an ultra lounge but it makes me feel like it's my rich uncles den and I was invited over for stiff drinks with dinner. Strolling through the dark, intimate Buddhist themed lounge in heels and a little black dress I felt like a predator making my way out to the belvedere. The view is stunning, it adds even more sex appeal to this beautiful lounge. During the winter heat lamps are provided but who needs those when this environment is perfect for getting warmth through drinks and body heat ;-)    I've been coming to Foundation Room for many moons now since I'm anti club kid but I need to occasionally entertain out of town guests. Foundation Room is owned by House of Blues and use to be available to members only. I felt privileged when I was invited to join the events in the past but now this gorgeous lounge is available to all to enjoy. I almost dare to say it's a unintentional best kept secret in Las Vegas. The crowd isn't young 20 something's, it's more 30-40's so you won't see little ladies having their hair held back in the bathrooms because drinking is a new thing to them. The dark romantic ambiance plays well with my soul, way more than the uber mega clubs on the strip.   It's not just a lounge mind you there is a fine restaurant here also. I really won't touch much onto that because it was years ago when I ate there and my memory is fairly faded about that night. I do remember drinks were abundant, stiff and I was all smiles and sunshine that night. I will just assume my food pleased me other wise the libations made the food extremely palatable.   Ladies and Gents, if you are like me and enjoy feeding your dark sultry side and  would rather be around class than frat boys and woo girls I suggest you make your way to the 63rd floor of Mandalay Bay.

Make no mistake, this is no nightclub. What you see here is what you get! There is an amazing view out on the balcony of the 63rd floor. The lounge area is elegant and I love the interior decoration present with the dark red decor and the Buddha statues everywhere!  Because it wasn't very busy here, we were offered access into the VIP room. We got a discounted bottle service and they also brought out a hookah set with many flavors! They had a professional photographer (pictures are hefty priced) as well. The whole three hours we were there, our group felt very taken care of.   If you are looking for a low-key place to dance and drink with your friends with a beautiful view, I present to you the Foundation Room.

This place is such a treasure here in Las Vegas! There's oh so many clubs, but after a while, the typical ones just become mundane. Foundation Room has the exclusive feel that most people are looking for.   We've been here on many occasions, with each time getting better! So, this review is LONG overdue. The nightclub is so fun! They have amazing GoGo dancers, guest DJs, celebrity appearances and a whole array of signature drinks,  along with VIP bottle service. The bar staff and servers are TOP NOTCH! .. And their executive hosts are very accommodating! They'll make your visit to Foundation Room unforgettable!   I had my birthday party there last year. The view of the strip is breathtaking! It's definitely the place you want to be to celebrate any special occasion. It's also without a doubt THEEE BEST venue to celebrate NYE! We took so many memorable pictures and video.   Last night was the first time we dined in the lounge. Highly recommended. We decided to eat in their comfortable lounge and tried a bunch of noms :-)  My favorite was the Saturn's Crust Grilled cheese! I'm still thinking about it as I type. We also tried the steak skewers, Korean fried chicken bao buns, and the Korean BBQ riblets. Everything was delicious! I can't wait to go back.. enjoy!
Get $100 certificate for $50 on restaurant.com. Bread dipping spreads so good. The food was good not great but we Loved the ambiance.
The views from the rooftop say it all. We came here after dinner for a nightcap and the atmosphere was relaxing with great music playing in the background.  *No fee for women after 10pm

The Foundation Room is a "VIP" Club at the top of Mandalay Bay. As you might imagine, it is pricy, but the food is not up to par with the cost.   Our party shared two appetizers - a flatbread pizza w/ shrimp and Kobe Beef Carpaccio. The pizza was decent, but tasted strangely of peanuts, and the Carpaccio was good, but I expect a bit more flavor from this type of ingredient.   My entree was the Horseradish-Encrusted Beef Tenderloin. I was not impressed, especially considering the steakhouse prices. The steak was cooked past medium and it was not juicy. The taste was good, but the horseradish crust was a little hard to eat, as it flaked off instead of being truly a part of the steak.   The Parsnip Purée was good, tasting mild like mashed potatoes, but it did have a baby food texture to it. There was only a small amount in the container. Three asparagus was an oddly small side dish as well.   As for the venue, the service was very good and the entire place smelled of Heavy incense.   I just want more flavor and satisfaction from a meal at that price.

Small area but very fun to go have a good time. The view from the balcony is amazing. One of the bar tenders was amazing and nice. The other one that was outside on the bar balcony was snobby. So we would walk all the way inside to get our drinks. The dancers are beautiful and nice. Drinks at spendy but that is how it is everywhere on the strip. Overall we would go again.

When you've had enough of the hoi polloi open your wallet and head over to the Foundation Room in the Mandalay Bay.  Take the private elevator that shoots you to the top of the hotel.  First have a cocktail in the bar which has a large patio overlooking the Strip.  Then sit down in the dining room where the food and the service are as good as you'll find in any first class restaurant.  The menu is American, with a variety of steak, lamb, seafood and so on.  Main courses run about $35-$45.  We had a very enjoyable evening and will be back.

It was something different instead of fancy decor they show off ancient artifacts with every room there is a theme, they host to mostly VIP celebs with a wide variety of choices to pick from. The photos tell a little about what kind of experience you will venture very unique

It's the Vegas strip.  It's not cheap, so don't expect it to be.  The Foundation Room has become my new favorite weekend dance club.  Despite $5 waters and $9 "cheap" beers, the music makes it worth it.  Admission is expensive, and unless you're either a) female - and can get $10 passes wandering through Mandalay Bay, or b) willing to grease the hand of the doorman (then he may give you his card and you can get this $10 priority admission for your local crew), you'll likely be asked for $30 at the door.  As a "local lady" in this town I can generally get into most clubs for free, but it's worth it to me to pay the $10 and go to the Foundation Room for our girls nights out.   The most compelling reason is THE MUSIC.  The DJ generally plays a great mix of hip hop, dance, and rock music from the 80's through today.  The variation is welcome compared to most clubs only playing the most contemporary music (regardless of the quality).  Second, the volume of the music keeps bringing us back!  You can actually hear each other talk in this club!  There's no doubt the volume is loud enough to get lost in if you wish, but even inside you can still understand what people are saying to you and ask your friends what they'd like to drink and hear the responses.  Plus, if you want a break from the boom-boom, just step outside on the balcony.  That brings us to the third plus, the balcony!  A smashing view of the Las Vegas Strip from the southern tip looking north.  If you're lucky enough to be there on a stormy summer night I highly recommend watching the lightening float across the clouds and crash on the surrounding Vegas mountains.  Of course there are drawbacks.  Drinks are expensive, and if you're not a rich looking guy the female bartenders will mostly ignore you.  The crowd seems to vary from spry young things to middle age male gawkers.  But, it's Vegas, what do you expect?  I've never found a lack of interesting people to talk to, and I welcome that I can actually hear what they're saying while booty-shakin' to some hip-hop that brings back college memories.

I really liked this place. Im not sure how much it was to get in we got passes to get in from House Of Blues. When we got up we also got drink passes. The whole place is nice! You can step outside and see the entire strip! The inside is nice as well, big couches pillows nice seating area. I didnt get to eat there so i cant tell you how the food was.

We came to the Foundation Room as a part of a wedding reception. We rode the elevator up from the lobby of Mandalay Bay and it was a long ride, I knew we were going up high. The second you walk into the Foundation Room it feels like you've escaped from the crazy Las Vegas life downstairs. The lighting is dark, the walls are all upholstered with patchwork, and you're met with an enormous glowing Buddha.   The room for the reception wasn't ready yet so we waited in the bar. The server's came around asking for drink orders and they were very nice and helpful. Shortly after we were directed to the room where the reception was. Similarly to the bar, the reception room had an amazing view of the Las Vegas strip and the mountains that lie behind. We were served light hors d'oeuvres- things such as baked brie with crusty bread, a vegetable platter, vegetarian sushi, hummus, and chocolate covered strawberries. A server walked around with bruschetta, ahi tuna, and duck skewers. All of the food was very good! In the reception room there was a full bar and the bartendars were quite good.  Later in the evening we ventured out into the main bar and went out onto the balcony. I wasn't wrong when I mentioned earlier that were high up. We were at the very top of Mandalay Bay looked down upon the strip. It was absolutely gorgeous and we felt completely removed from the craziness below! I'd love to say that I will be returning here, but since it requires a membership I do not think that will be happening. If you get the chance to go, do it, it's beautiful!

There aren't too many roof top bar spaces left in vegas, or so it seems. I like the laid back, chill vibe here. The foundation room is a nice little spot at the Mandalay Bay. The dress code is a lot more casual than other clubs like Marquee, Surrender, XS, Omnia, etc.  I don't mind the slightly older crowd at all. There's a lot less BS and almost no worries about someone doggin' someone else. Drinks are stiff, even if you're redeeming the complimentary drink passes that the girls get for coming in before a certain time.  Bottles here aren't too pricey.  I tend to come here after dinner with friends who aren't looking to get into something like a club but do want to go out. The view is pretty with all the sparkling lights. I haven't ever had to pay, not me or anybody in my group. I try and make contact with different promoters to get free admission for myself and my group. Of course a lot of that has to do with the ratio of women to men trying to come in but maybe I've just gotten lucky all the dozens of times I've visited. So...really, come here if you're looking for something easy going, casual, not EDM-y, and want a nice view. The view is where it's at!!

Really, I give it about 3.5 stars.  The view is excellent, and as a Chicago based visitor I didn't think the drinks were all that expensive.  If you're that worried about what you pay for a drink then keep playing your 5 cents per hand video poker and let the casino drink girls bring your beverages for tips.   The view is great! Because Mandalay is at the far end of the strip, you get a full view of the casinos and lights, including the airport. (If you feel daring, you could always try and claim one of the private jets is yours in a pickup line).  All in all, the place is a more private area.  Yes, on Monday nights the public can get access but otherwise it is for members only.  If you have the opportunity to go, it's worth the trip and the price of a few cocktails. Just don't show up in shorts and tennis shoes or they won't let you in.

Been a frequent visitor to the foundation room for the last 7 years but this time they really dropped the ball.  I was attending my mothers post wedding dinner and they "upgraded" the party to a private room. The standard menu is quite good however in this case they completely phoned it in. Not only was the food below par but the private room was a cave. The standard dining room has amazing strip views while the "upgraded" room had zero windows, poor service and was a terrible experience. If you have a group do not book here and I will never spend my money here again. Further more, my mother is legally not allowed to comment on this due to their contract for large parties. Pre-meditated damage control?

All I have to say is wow.   I'm not the club hopping, silk shirt wearing type of guy, but give me a view and a stiff cocktail and I'll be just fine. The Foundation Room has this interesting hidden jungle temple look on the inside and the outside it's more of a smoky lounge style vibe. Multiple couches, a bar and a view to kill for.    Like I said the view is ridiculous, you can see all the way down the strip and even watch planes land at McCarran airport. I came here during the day for a private event, but I can only imagine what the Strip lights look like at night. Or I can just look at the photos on their Yelp profile...naw, I'll just come back.   If you want to impress on a first date or show off to your out-of-town friends, this might be a good place to start. I'll definitely be coming back.

Outstanding and Very memorable drinking and Dining Experience with the Best LV STRIP and city View!! Great decor amd ambience!! Fellows you cant go wrong taking your babe here!! Great steaks,  sea food appetizers and awesome deserts!! The Fall time Pear Tart is a MUST!! Service is Good too!! Have a great time dont miss this place and Cheers!!

Mandalay Bay has created one of the most beautifully furnished restaurants on the strip. The view is at the end of the strip. Inside is what really makes this place unforgettable! Ancient artifacts with so much history fill the rooms. From the tables, to the carpet. It really is breathtaking! Parvati, Ganesha, Persian decor... must see! I recommend the crab cakes

I've been to the House of Blues Foundation Room about five times over the past few years.  Lets just say the WOW factor has dropped.  It seems each time I go there the service gets worse.  The service isn't bad but it's no better than anywhere else.     The first time I was there it seemed like we had two waitresses waiting on us.  They would explain everything to you about the menu and help make choice if you were undecided.  If you left your table and went to the bathroom, your napkin would be re-folded and all your crumbs would be swept away.  If you ordered a bottle of wine it would be kept cool in a chiller.    Well all of that is gone.  The food is still good, but the wow factor has left.

Stayed at The Hotel at Mandalay and decided to check out this place. As everyone has mentioned the view of the strip is great - lot's of couples getting pictures taken on the balcony with the strip in view. The decor inside is very cool, dark and comfortable - nice place to relax and sip a drink. My only knock on this place was the service by the  two cocktail waitresses - neither one stopped by to ask us for another drink - thought maybe it was me or my brother LOL then I noticed they both avoided pairs of guys or women - they were only interested in serving couples I guess kind of funny and also rude.
