This was hands down the BEST STEAK I've had in my life!! Got comped bc we got the intimate package for Carlos Santana at House of Blues. Mandalay Bay was not as busy, I'm thinking I know why,but nevertheless Shawn our server was prompt and knew we only had 1 hour to dine bc we made late reservations. Anyways always go with the steak here you will know with the first bite that they use nothing but quality in this restaurant/lounge.  The View is amazing too. It's on the 62 floor, took a bunch of selfies in the outside patio,yes outside patio (scary if you are afraid of heights like me) but you have to do the "touristy" thing any take as many pictures as possible. Enjoy!!!

We were staying at THEhotel and got on the guest list on Friday to the Foundation Room when we checked in.  In hindsight, it was one of the best places we have visited during this weekend visit: no cover, no grease or table service needed, crowd and music were good, and drinks weren't overpriced.  The view of the strip from 20+ floor was nice (but soon got beat by the view from Mix, also in Mandalay Bay but on the 60+ floor).  They also have a few dancers to keep the scene warm and the guys happy.
Such an amazing view, such a horrible sound system and crowd. At least my drinks and entry were free

We had a reservation for a special birthday for 10 people on a Saturday night.  Had made it months in advance with two requests - one a paper menu with no prices (has been done before for others who attended events here) and second was for a sugar free dessert option for the 70 year old birthday girl because she is diabetic.  Had multiple conversations with a number of people leading up to the evening including a woman on the day of the event at 2pm who confirmed they had those two requests were noted and there were NO ISSUES.  Then about 90 minutes before we were to arrive we got a call from an unapologetic manager named Jay who said who could not do either for us on such "short notice"  Seriously???  He could not have cared less.  Oh and he offered to let us bring in our own sugar free dessert if we could find it and they would only charge us $7 per person to serve it.  Needless to say we went to a different place that was happy to have us.  What a complete disappointment from a place that should be the tops at customer service.

Food was excellent and ambience was an A+ but the overly big bouncers were ridiculous. I lowered to three stars because of them. They literally shouted at my husband and were very rude after someone threatened to kick my husbands butt because the other guy was sloppy and drunk. We got yelled at like school children and were told to go where the other guy was hanging out ??? Really ??? Ummmm no thanks . The security(one guy) finally came to his senses after the steroids wore off and said we could stay where we were. duh !!

This lounge is located on the top of Mandalay Bay hotel. The have a seating area outside in the open which provides stunning views of the Las Vegas strip.   We visited on a Monday and the service was quite good. I would recommend getting on a guest list which would get you free entry as a couple and sometimes free drinks. The interiors are modeled on an Indian theme. Most of it is well done but the murals/sculptures of Indian gods and goddess look quite out of place in a club/lounge.   The DJ was quite good and she was playing a good mix of Top 40 and hip-hop. We found this place to be more upscale than their counterparts in the city.
Not a bad view when you're dancing and drinking the Vegas night air away! I had fun here for sure.
Dimitri is the best Host! Love this place. Gorgeous view, great drinks and bomb music!

I ended up here randomly after a promoter handed us passes with two free drinks when we were headed to Light. He told us that there was an awesome view so we decided to check it out.   I'm so glad we did. Foundation Room, located inside Mandalay, has one of the best rooftop views of the strip that I have seen.  Even though it was super cold out, we stayed for awhile taking pictures. The outside area isn't that big so it was crowded with people taking pictures.  But, bc it was also cold out, people didn't stay long.   The inside was packed and the music was pumping. It's got a really interesting Asian type ambiance on the inside.  Although do find it really weird to see one of my Hindu gods displayed in a venue filled with drunk scantily clad people. As gorgeous as the statues are, they're out of place.    Definitely check this place out for the view. It's worth it.

Sexy ambience, incredible view and delectable drinks. Expensive, no doubt about it...but if you come to a place like this in Vegas thinking otherwise you are delusional. I usually go to MIXX Lounge, but I think I might like this place better!  Perfect place to start a fun night
So fun! Great view! Food was awesome. Staff was great! Get a table to rest your feet.

Are you interested in partying on the top of Las Vegas?! Literally speaking! On 63rd floor of Mandalay Bay you will find this hip & elegant lounge aka "The Foundation Room" ! I couldn't have selected a better place to be my 1,000th review on Yelp! Whoo hooo!   The Foundation Room has been from what I've heard an on and off members only establishment, however when I clarified if this was still something in place with the hostess at the entry of the club she explained that "non-members" are granted entry only if they have reservations for the Dining Room. Also, for the "non-members" If you are interested in going beyond the Dining Room and into the lounge area you may do so, just as long as it's after 10:00 PM.   Prior to my most recent visit I've had the pleasure of taking one hell of an elevator ride up here a time or two before. Each time I've visited this place there has always been a memorable moment created! My girlfriends were visiting from Atlanta, GA and brought me along on one of those wild and crazy Nightclub Crawl Party buses and this place was on the list! Go figure with that though because the spot to meet was actually at Mandalay Bay, so of course we would kick off the night of fun here!   After waiting not too long in the VIP line, we were finally granted access and went through the normal security check and lead to the elevators. It's almost like a nirvana when you take a step off the elevator into this hidden gem of a lounge. Dimly lit, you will find one center bar that has some of the most nice bartenders I've ran across in Las Vegas. The drinks are priced at the normal of what cocktails are usually in Las Vegas so no complaints on that. They have something called "Nibbles & Sips" hour Sun-Thu from 5:00PM-8:00PM so I encourage you to check that out. Music has always been great so I'm sure you can find something that will be played you can hit the dance floor to.   Last but not least! Make sure you take a step out onto the wrap around balcony and soak up that incredible view of Las Vegas! This view actually in my opinion has to be one of the best if not the best that the city can offer you. I'm sure there will be plenty more opportunities that I will return and I can't wait! Enjoy!

Top floor with great views. Small space with outdoor large balcony area and indoor space (kind of like Mix also in Mandalay). It's dark and the music is top 40 and EDM. Drinks aren't really strong. The crowd seems 30ish and classy. I'd come back. Had a great time.

Be careful... manager has a scam going.  Had no plans to go here.   Lured us in with free entry and free drink tickets.   They had an oriental screen by a door in a dark room which we knocked over going in. They said we broke it and charged us $200 for it.   Said pay them or goto jail.  They took our drivers licenses, made us sit down on a step on the floor and had 6 security guards bully us.  We paid... I wonder how many other people "broke" their same screen.    Horrible experience.  My friend cried all the way home.  It was her birthday too.

This place is hit or miss! I honestly come here for the views and it is breathtaking with the views of the strip and a glass of wine at sunset what more can you ask for? Well that being said, food! But don't, because you will have a one hour wait time for a happy hour special of prosciutto which basically breaks down to burnt flat bread topped with lettuce and tomatoes! Which is what I had tonight. I complained to the waitress who told me it was not burnt but sent it back then when I tried to pay $25 on a $10 check  she took the entire  thing and didn't bring me back any change! When I finally caught up with her and asked for my change I gave her a $5 tip and she angrily pushed me in the hallway! So I told the manager on duty who was another woman in a pink striped shirt, she then proceeded to escort me and my friends out of the Foundation Room while I am telling her how rude the waitress was to me after tipping  her 50%! Wow I have never been so disrespected! Usually ppl are really nice in Vegas but this was an unpleasant encounter.    I do like the Foundation Room and found it a great place to relax with coworkers after a long day at work and watch the sunset on the strip but after tonight I am really disappointed and embarrassed for them. They did not deal with the situation in the proper way and I honestly I do not know if I would return or invite anyone here!  They were very unorganized and I literally dealt with three servers and a buss boy before I could get my order and received it burnt! I received excuses upon excuses anywhere from "the kitchen is backed up" to "it's not burnt it's well done" then they tried to kick me out when I complained. There was literally less than 50ppl there and the manager tried to tell me that my waitress had already left for the night so I couldn't get my change when it was only 8:20pm but I placed my order at 7:30pm! SMH What a Shame!

The tundish room is the place to go in Las Vegas, the best view, the best drinks, the best atmosphere, and the best service. The foundation room is the only true museum in Las Vegas with over 11,000 ancient artifacts. If you haven't gone you got to go

Long time favorite spot at Mandalay Bay. We hang out upstairs on all our Vegas trips. Members only club. Always an interesting crowd. The balcony has great views down the strip. Bartenders here make a good cocktail! Dancing is always fun here.  Nice lounge vibe with several different rooms.

I was here for an afterparty.  We did not have food at the party which was upsetting because I've heard great things about their food.  Inorder to get upstairs to the foundation room, you have to go through some pretty intense security which is nice but annoying.  They wouldn't let the media take their cameras upstairs.    The service upstairs was just what you want in Vegas.  Fast, funny, friendly, and good to look at.  Its hard not to give this place a 5 with probably the best view in all of Vegas, but without trying to food its hard to give them that full 5 star.  I would definitely come back and try the food.  You will feel like a boss when you go up there.  I am not a boss by any stretch of the imagination but i sure did feel like one!

Went for drinks and dancing on 30 Jan 15, a Friday night. The place was packed, the music was cool and the ceiling was beautiful. Idk why, but I really liked the ceiling. It was raining so the outdoor patio area was closed off, making the rest of the room crowded and tough to get my dance on, my moves require lots of space.  The temp/air flow wasn't optimal, and neither was the carpet, for my dancing, I do a lot of heel work...But overall we had fun. I enjoyed the decorations.   Bonus*** Charles Barkley was there and he gave me a head nod. I would recommend getting one of these if you get be chance.   It was free to get in, the drinks were cheaper than most clubs and you get them fast. I wouldn't go back, but I would recommend if you're staying at Mandalay Bay or you're over the EDM super clubs, give this place a shot. Boom.

Best view of the Vegas strip by far.  Foundation Room is my type of place.  I hate clubs.  I think they are obnoxious and bring out douche-central. I like lounges, such as this.  Great music, outdoor seating aplenty, dark & swanky atmosphere and eye candy for all.  Cheers!  You just found the BEST place to hang out on the Vegas strip.

First of all it was a little confusing when I made the reservation, they have a restaurant and a lounge. Their website sends you to Open table and that reserves you a table in the restaurant. We got there after 10pm and that's when they close the kitchen, luckily for us since we didn't want eat too much that late. But this gives you access to the adjacent lounge which is awesome! I'm not sure what other ways are there for non-members, we'll have to figure out till next time. The lounge is scented, loud and sexy! Music sounds great, people around you are in a state of open inquiry and bliss and you'll get there too, it's contagious. We stayed mostly outside where we made friends with everyone taking pictures of the gorgeous view, a lot of them were from CES (the current convention that week) so we got to talk to some, it's great place to spend a late night on a special occasion.

Loved this place the moment we stepped foot inside of the elevator to get to the top.  Seven of us girls were in search of a great time and we found it here at the Foundation Room!  Advertised as exclusive and VIP, I thought to myself that surely they were trying to front like other Vegas clubs.  I drank my words as we were offered free champagne and cocktails while dancing to some hot beats!  FR offers 3 rooms with spacious dance floors and a patio that is perfect for their gorgeous panoramic view of the Vegas strip.  I admit that their dance floors are pretty small, but after several drinks you won't even notice the cramped space that has you dancing right up on another person :).  The aforementioned patio was a perfect place to get fresh air and if you can handle folks smoking in your "fresh" air (which was a bit of a turnoff but whatever), you get a chance to take in all of the magical spark that makes the Vegas strip what it is.  We ended our night here and wished that we started it off at this spot.  Great people, great atmosphere, and I would definitely party it up here again.
The food was amazing 1st time there with family. The best view, friendly staff, I would go again. The only thing I wasn't happy with is they have  a dress code. Very happy customer!!!!

Sat at the bar.  Very nice atmosphere.   Bartender excellent service warm and friendly.  Had apps  bar all excellent flavorful good eats.  If in Mandalay Bay you should go.  Great view on outdoor deck 64 floors up.

I've been here on several occasions and it's cozy and has a nice view of the Strip. I've never had the food here though- just the cocktails.  It's got a very polished New Orleans feel to the place. It's like a lounge in the French Quarter meets Disneyland.   The venue seems to attract an older crowd but maybe it's me that's older and the nights I come here are for events that draw us old folks out of our suburban homes. Are you 40 or 50-something? You'll dig the low key atmosphere.  Are you a 20 something club kid? Probably not the place you want to be.

Went here on 9/6/15. Was sadly disappointed. We were in town for labor day weekend, and had a reservation for Sunday night. The rack of lamb I ordered was charred and fatty and flavorless all at the same time. The carrots were charred to a crisp. The squash fritters were pretty good. The plating was pathetic!! We went to Gallagher's steakhouse at New York New York the night before, and got a rack of lamb there as well, and it was perfect!

This review is for a visit during Restaurant Week. We arrived 20 minutes early for our 6:30 reservation. Upon check in at the hostess stand we were escorted to the lounge and would be called when our table was ready. A peak into the restaurant reveled many available tables but maybe their policy is not to seat guests early and also help increase the lounge beverage business. The lounge has plenty of interesting art and a great view of the strip from the outdoor patio. At 6:30 the hostess escorted to our dining room table. The dining room also has an patio with an outdoor bar. Live music begins later in the evening. The artwork in the dining  room is also interesting. However, the room is tired and needs fresh paint and cleaning. Dust is obvious on some of the light fixtures and the light fixtures above the wall art could be better positioned so they are not skewed. Our server was Amanda and she was assisted by Otto. Both  were attentive and knowledgeable of the menu Otto was especially talkative and entertaining.  Both of us ordered from the Restaurant week menu.  The crab cake appetizer consisted of two large patties topped by apple fennel slaw and surrounded by an apple mustard sauce. This dish was light and flavorful. The slaw added a nice crunch. The 6 oz Filet of Beef was tender and cooked as requested. The baby carrots and cippolini onions were a perfect complement. The Shrimp Thai Curry main course was described as spicy by our server. It delivered fantastic flavor with a pronounced amount of heat. The large shrimp were served in curry along with eggplant, cilantro, mint and Honshimeji mushrooms. A separate bowl contained a large portion of jasmine rice. I highly recommend this dish if you enjoy a spicy experience.  The molten chocolate cake includes two chocolate ganache truffles, and two raspberries. The truffles just melt in your mouth. The cake could have had more molten chocolate. The calvados apple bread pudding with vanilla Ice Cream included a side container of warm sticky pecan caramel. When poured over the pudding it just melted the Ice Cream and soaked into the pudding. Just delicious and very rich.  The Foundation Room is more a 4 star than 3 because the food and service out shine the need to freshen up the space. Refurbishing would help improve the the overall experience.

Wow! I'm a regular here. In fact I was married here many years ago and was super close to buying a membership here until tonight. Vegas Strong my ass! Me and my girls came here after a Knights game and one of the bouncers was so nasty to us because we wearing Knights hats. It's ok to ask me to remove my hat, but this guy was so mean about it. That's not cool. He said if I didn't like it, I could go to one of the other many clubs in Vegas.

Can I just say that I have lived in Vegas for almost 4 years now and I have no idea that Foundation Room served food? Sure, I've been to the nightclub before (and it's a good place to take your older friends who just want to chill in a cool, loungy, not super trendy atmosphere) but a restaurant!? Blasphemy (see what I did there?)!  For my birthday this year, my boyfriend wanted to surprise me by taking me out to dinner somewhere special and he would not tell me where. Apparently, after sifting through menus all over town, he settled on Foundation Room.  While I'm told the main course menu is delicious, we just stuck to eating tapas style and ordered a bunch of appetizers to split. Of those, the Fresh Shucked Oysters and the Duck Confit are of particular note. The oysters were fresh and not overpowering. The Duck Confit is pretty much one of the best things I have ever eaten. It was so soft, flavourful and just melted in my mouth.  The service was impeccable and our waiter was one of the best I have ever had in my life. He was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about the menu, especially the wine list. I really appreciated how "real" he was with us. Usually when you are torn between two wines, a waiter will upsell you to another more expensive bottle, or try to sway you to choose the pricier of the two. Our didn't. He told us his honest, unbiased opinion of both bottles to help us make a decision without any underlying motive. That is always appreciated.   To top off a fantastic meal, the restaurant gave us a wonderful plate of complimentary desserts for my birthday and even gave us a deal on the check! It was one of the best dining experiences I have had in this city and I will definitely be returning soon!

I'm only giving two stars because of the view. The service was horrible. Three girlfriends and I are staying at Mandalay Bay and decided to head up for a drink. We sat at the bar for quite some time and not one server came up to us. One of the girls went over to the other side of the bar where all 4 bartenders were gathered talking and asked to be helped. After 10 more minutes they still didn't come to take our order. Horrible service and not a great experience as a Mandalay Bay guest.

I'm not ENTIRELY sure what's going on here.. But I like it. The entire place smells of incense; I think it's coming from a vent above the door, and is covered with tapestries and carpets. My friend, who had brought me here for drinks, said when he called for information, they were able to tell him the origins of the carpets and tapestries.. But of course he couldn't remember it.   The music is nice, but definitely not something you would dance to. A lounge in the truest meaning of the word, there are several cozy sofas and fireplaces to lounge around, along with a balcony with a lovely view. They have some private rooms as well.. Mostly an older crowd, and a great place to meet a friend or colleague for a few drinks.   As for dress code, most people were dressed in "party attire", but there were also people just dressed like they had come straight from the office. Of course, it was quite early when we went.   Will definitely return.

On my recent trip to Vegas, a good friend took us here.  He  was able to get us into this place for no charge, since he is a member ($30 charge normally). First off, I have to say "WHAT A VIEW!"  and second, "WHAT A VIEW" . . wow, unparalleled unrestricted  views of the Las Vegas Strip that cannot be beat.    The Foundation Room is kind of hard to find.  You have to take a super secret velvet roped elevator to the top.  When you step off that elevator, you are transported to a very sophisticated  ultra lounge with middle eastern/asian decor. Its dark and serene.  Plush couches/seating surrounds you.  Step up to the bar and get your hands on a drink, then head out the doors behind the bar to the patio to soak in the view.  After enjoying a drink outside, head back in to the five star restaurant for some fantastic dining.   Your waiter will start you off with a complementary bread basket with a broad assortment of breads, even a soft pretzel type of bread which I really enjoyed. We ordered some appetizers: Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes, Oysters on the Half Shell, Cheese and Charcuterie tray.  Now for the entrees, we ordered Osso Bucco, Horseradish Crusted Steak, Lamb, Braised Mushrooms, Truffle Macaroni and Cheese and Grilled Asparagus, all of which were to die for.   Dessert had some interesting choices: Lemon Olive Oil Cake, Apple Bread Pudding and Molten Chocolate cake.  Strict dress code enforced, so dress nicely!

I went there with some friends for drinks before going out. This is a pretty good place but rather small and very packed after 9pm. This place mostly plays Hip/Hop music.  This place is located inside The Mandalay Bay hotel and you can conveniently park at their parking lot (Paid!). The Foundation Room is a rather small place that is divided into an outdoor/balcony area on one side and a club/lounge area on the other side which makes it pretty interesting. Unfortunately, there is very little room to dance so don't count too much on that...   The best thing about this place is definitely the view. If you stand outside, you can get a view of the whole strip.  The drinks are good and service is ok, except when the place gets very crowded late in the evening. It can be hard to get drinks then. One good thing about this place is the decor/atmosphere which makes it pretty unique in Las Vegas. Expect to pay $12 for most drinks event though girls can sometimes get free drinks tickets.  In conclusion, I would say that this is a pretty good place to get a drink before going out and I would recommend it. Feel free to message me for any additional details that you may need!

The view is the best of the strip. Its a kinda small club but I actually liked the intimacy that the small size provided vs the mega clubs thats standard in Vegas. The music was a mix which I appreciated, I dont like to listen to the same kind of music all night long. The drinks were kinda pricy but whats not in Vegas???  The foundation room is cool with me. Id party here again.

This review is for the lounge area only and NOT the restaurant or the food. My group and I didn't really like the place too much. Mostly because of the decor..We are Indian and didn't like how there were statues of Hindu Gods used as decoration. I myself am not very religious but I still have respect for others beliefs specially since some members of my family are Hindu. You wouldn't use Jesus Christ on a cross as decoration in a bar or club, then why have Hindu gods in a place that serves alcohol, plays loud uncensored music, and has scantily clad women walking around? I want people to understand its not the music, girls, or alcohol im against, This is Vegas and all of that is acceptable here and I always have fun with all three. BUT religious decor just doesn't belong in a bar, lounge or club. I liked the other decor but we all felt Mandalay Bay should have held out on the statues of gods and deities. Some of the statues we saw are similar, if not the same as, ones we see in Hindu temples, so to see them in a setting like this was weird and offensive.   This was the first stop on our party bus tour of Vegas clubs and lounges and Foundation Room has a very nice view of the strip. It rivals that of Ghost Bar and Voodoo at the RIo. 2/5 stars for the view and free drinks.

We went here to see the fireworks on New Years and paid $300 for me and my husband to watch them from the balcony. They did not tell us that it was an additional charge for the balcony. The security staff were really rude also. So we were stuck in the bar with no view of the fireworks with the worst music playing. Nightmare. The bartender was great!  But we will never come here again, nor will we recommend this spot. Poor customer service fail.

Nothing special about this room. It was nice that it was private and you could rent the space for a party, but it still had that dingy Vegas feel. The food being served was extremely subpar. There was no place to put used plates or glass wear. Literally! And no wait staff coming in to take anything for the hour I was there before deciding to leave.

We had a small 3 person crew and were headed into a show at Mandalay Bay when we were approached by what appeared to be a hotel employee with tickets to the Foundation Room. We listened to his pitch about spectacular views and dancing and great bar atmosphere. Ladies were free, guys were $20. We found the hidden elevator to the 63rd floor for this place, got to the top and figured out pretty quickly we had been suckered into something that was not a dance atmosphere, and the spectacular views were slim to none. The bar area outdoor patio was packed, very tiny space, and the view was not spectacular. The place was darker than any steak house I had ever been to which was a bit creepy. Very small bar, not many places to stand. All in all, I am confident they cater to a particular group, but it certainly was not what my group was looking for.

Yes yes!! Came here for the Ahern company Christmas party last week and had such an amazing time. Andy works for Ahern and we were lucky enough to apart of this evening. We started on the patio for drinks and odurves. The bartenders were so awesome! Talk about some girls with high volume experience. We then moved into the dining room and started out with a crab cake appetizer, amazing! I also let a server know of my nut allergy and every time I was served they assured me everything was nut free, I really appreciated that!  Second coarse was a salad. I don't know what they put in the dressing but it was mildly addictive.  Final coarse Andy and I shared both of our meals. A filet minon with mashed potatoes on his end and I had the Salmon with the jasmin white rice. Both were phenomenal. I must say the filet won. So good! We had a few cups of coffee and then enjoyed the lounge after. Such an amazing experience. The staff were so on point. We will for sure be back.

Staying at The Delano Hotel I was able to get on the guest list for the Foundation Room.  I tried getting dinner reservations however they were all booked that they could not accommodate my request.  Although, you can order appetizers in the lounge.   My girlfriends first arrived at The Foundation and decided to leave and have dinner at Mix on the top of the Delano Hotel instead.   Upon returning, the lounge and club area was packed and filled with a lot of people.  So a little tip:  (turn right)  When entering, you can turn right or left.  We turned left into the lounge area and made our way outside to the balcony.  What a beautiful view.  The DJ was jamming some good music and dancers were around.   Later in the evening we found out that there were other rooms.  We then ended up going to the farther room (if I had turn right) which seems brighter in lighting and better crowd.  Music was being played by apl.de.ap of Black Eye Peas.  The dance floor was bigger than the other room and I had more fun in that room as oppose to the first room we partied in.    Overall, If I was to stay in the Mandalay Bay or Delano Hotel, I would definitely return to The Foundation Room.  Great place to dance and chill.

Rating 4.5 stars I am digging this place. The night we went it was a Sunday night and the place was full but not overly so that you can't walk around the place. Lots of comfy leather chairs to lounge on, good music and a full bar that won't keep you waiting. The inside has dark and rich tones, lots of framed art- from the odd to the strange, decorated ceilings and lots of things that catch your attention. I like that they have some private rooms that is ornately decorated- seems to be a harem styled room-swags of cloth, rich decoration and lots of gold and reds. That night they had a burlesque performer...very fitting for this place.   The main attraction here is the view and the lights of Sin City. The view is spectacular...amazing. I heard the Foundation Room seems to be members only but once in a while, they do open this place to the public. If you can, go...it is nice change from the big clubs on the strip and the views will have you appreciating vegas a lil bit more.
Foundation Room at Mandalay Bay has one of the most beautiful views of Las Vegas. Camille, our bartender was awesome!! The DJ played decent music. It is a nice place to have drinks and mingle.

I've visited the Foundation Room and This Review is for the bar/lounge. Normally it is $30 a person to get up to the foundation room but we got in for free one of my companies clients had gotten us a balcony cabana .  Normally You would have to go to the house of blues gift shop first to get the actual vouchers. Then you go to the four seasons elevator area to he admitted. we got curb service! Once you get to the top & into the lounge it has interesting decor & low key vibe.  There are couches & a bar area inside but most people are out on the balcony to see the best view on the strip. the are private rooms but we didn't go down there the humidor was off the hook too but pricey   Since Mandalay bay is at the south end of the strip, you get a full and amazing northbound view of the strip from high up. It's fantastic.  The drinks are pricey ,bought 2 coronas and 3 mixed drinks it was $50 bucks Vegas baby!

Went with a group of friends last night and overall was not impressed. On the positive side, the view of the strip from the balconies is gorgeous. That said - the food and service was disappointing. The waiter asked if we had time bound plans after dinner and we said no.  It was a mistake to be honest. It took almost 90 minutes from the time we got there until we got our food. When it did come, the fish was overdone for one guest, the steak was underdone for another, and the rest was just ok. They had run out of iceberg for their wedge salad which we were told about before we ordered, but they also apparently ran out of romaine for the Caesar as well - which we learned of when it arrived with baby lettuce. I get it's a first world problem but when the prices are high - so are the expectations.  That said the asparagus and tempura cauliflower were great.  The kitchen really needs to tighten up their operations and their management team could do better at service recovery. I won't be rushing back.

A good experience, but the best part was the view.  I was recently in Las Vegas for a Bachelorette party, and the Foundation room was her dinner pick. The restaurant hostess was nice enough (maybe smart enough) to tuck us away in a private dining room where we could be as loud as we wanted. There the decor was outdated and kind of strange, but the views overlooking the west were to die for, especially as the sun when down.  It happened to be Restaurant week in Vegas so a few of us ordered from the 3 course Prix fixe menu for $50. The feedback from that was: the salad was ok, the steak was delicious, and while it tasted good, everyone was too full for dessert. I went rogue and split the truffle mac and cheese and the caprese salad. They were good, just wish the mac and cheese was a bit more truffle-y. Drink seemed to be the highlight of everyone's meal and they were average in price- $7 for a Beer, $15ish for wine and a cocktail.  The Bachelorette's future sister in law who couldn't make the trip was nice enough to order us a round of drinks and dessert from back home. The servers kindly orchestrated that fun surprise. But overall, service was a little slow. It was nice to not be rushed, but we were often wishing they'd walk by so we could order another drink and by the end we were just sitting around and waiting for our checks.   After dinner we went to the night club next door. Awesome view of the strip- pictures just don't do it justice! While we enjoyed the DJ's music, we left around 11pm to go to our next destination. The outside patio was pretty empty, but inside seemed to be bumping.

This review is only for the lounge.  Cool and hip decore, decent music, and without a doubt the best view in Vegas! The prices of drinks are expensive, but you are paying for the view and atmosphere. Not a place I would stay all night, but definitely a must do for Vegas.

AMAZING experience and best food. The staff there are on point with their service. Got there a bit early but was able to enjoy the lounge before we were sat for dinner.  Dave was spot on and his recommendation were the best. I went with a party of four and we all got something different. We were all able to sample each other's plate. Everything was great. I'm a purest and we all choose not to make any changes to our orders. Food was beyond amazing. If you have an chance to dine or every enjoy the Foundation Room. Go and don't look back. You will have the best time and want to come back for more!!!

Came here once late night and had a ball. Was going out to eat but ended up here. Fun atmosphere. Not for the 20s crowd expecting a typical club scene. Was able to score seats outside and had some nibbles. View is fantastic, even for a local.  Came here a second time in the afternoon and sat outside. Certainly not as impressive as late night, but that's true of most things when copious amounts of alcohol are involved. There was also a large crowd due to a political fundraiser so a much different crowd. We were there for my bday. Nothing grabbed us so we headed elsewhere.   Enjoy that it's not as touristy as many of the other strip bars.
Great views and good food. Portions for appetizers were small or I'd give it 5 stars.

Amazing view, but that's all they get points for. Spent over 200 dollars for an unseasoned filet which had to be sent back because it was completely rare and we ordered medium, and when it came back, it was still well undercooked. New York strip was chewy but at least it was seasoned well. Scallops were underwhelming, and I am a huge scallop fan, but these were mediocre especially if you are paying $20 for only two of them. Lobster was very nice, but was hardly a meal saver. Had the chocolate cake for desert and it was nice if a little too rich. Service was very kind and friendly, atmosphere was quite nice as well, but food is everything when it comes to this sort of price tag, and I have had better versions of these dishes at just about any other place i've been.

House of Blues Foundation Room is located on top of Mandalay Bay. Once you exit the elevator, you 'll feel like you've entered some far-off land that blends elements of India with England and Ireland as well as the American South. There are beautiful sculpture and carvings of animals and humans.   The lounge area ie the main venue for drinking, socializing and dancing are covered by a patchwork of fabrics in deep red, orange and gold.  My favorite spot is the balcony, it truly is a must-see spot for the best view in the city. My friends and I were here last night for the Halloween Party. They had great music and free drinks for the ladies until midnight. The only thing is I wish the lounge area was bigger but what a great night!

On a recent stay at Delano my girls and I went to Foundation Room for some pre club drinks. The view from the 64th floor is epic! (Mix has the same view but the lounge is most def not as nice) Music and drinks were totally on point. The atmosphere was super chill. The decor really funky and fun. Not really sure how much the cover is since my VIP casino host took us up but I know there are people downstairs always offering free admission. Whatever the cover though it would be worth it... Bartenders are super fun, friendly and make good drinks. Perfect pre clubbing lounge to get you warmed up for a night of shenanigans!
Between the music and the view you can't go wrong. With so many places to compete for your attention in Vegas, the Foundation Room is definitely worth visiting.

"The sensor is like a clitoris.  Once you find it, you're all set."  This was what was told to me by the bathroom attendant as I was having trouble engaging the sensor at the sink.  I had to share the story with my friends once I got back to the table.  I was torn between a 3 and a 4 here.  The Foundation room is on the top floor of Mandalay Bay.  You need to be a member to get up here, but fortunately on our trip for NYE, one of our friends' brother had a comped meal so we all had dinner there for FREE!  FREE!  Ain't nothing wrong with free.  The pain in the ass was that it took us 7 hours to drive from LA, normally a 3-4 hour trip.  Most of us weren't going to wear formal shoes.  Yet that was their policy.  Literally, some of us were wearing t-shirts and track jackets, but apparently as long as you wear formal shoes, you can get in.  As we got in, we saw the person at the elevator on the first floor preventing an irate woman from letting her and her "date" in.  The food was pretty good and the service was amazingly fast.  The 8 of us ordered 4 starters, an entree each, and 3 desserts as well as several beers.  ALL COMPED!  There was nothing spectacular about the food but it was pretty good.  After dinner we went to the adjacent rooms and walked around the dance floors.  The music was super loud and people were partying the night away.  We didn't dance as we were tired, but we did appreciate the fantastic views of the strip from the top floor terrace.  Were it not for the stupid dress code (we had to rush back to our hotel to get proper shoes for our 10:15p reservation), I wouldn't be so torn about giving it a 4.  The service, comped meal, hilarious attendee made this a solid 4.

For the old world, exotic, far Eastern Asia vibe that takes you on the top of a Vegas resort hotel that glistens in golden yellow? Take yourself up 64 floors up Mandalay Bay! But not quite a place for everyone, for this is an exclusive club requiring club membership: The Foundation Room. Although you may get a chance to step foot in this through an event, pay cover charge, or VIP access, or via a Host, or a private party. (Recently held my birthday party in this venue!) With warm red furnishings' colors and purple-bluish lighting, plush furniture, a "roaring" fireplace in the main lounge overlooking the bar, an inspiring 1856 decor, 18th century paintings, walls adorned with buddhas, all cozy to take you to a faraway land. A large wooden chair by the elevators will accommodate at least three people, somehow made me feel like a Princess sitting on it. At least my friend thinks I look like a Princess he remarked after the photo. DJ music plays to get your dance groove on. Cocktails in the bar are quite reasonably affordable. The bartender and servers were attentive. Dining menu includes steak, vegetarian, and Asian, Indian,  Mediterranean flair served in white linen, white tableware, crystal stemware, and gleaming silverware. VIP host was accommodating and helpful in making my birthday party a memorable one. There are seven exclusive VIP chambers to hold your private party. Such rooms have the decors of Buddhas, stately Gothic style, Ganesh Prayer Rooms, and an 1856 style room. And best of all, there is the romantic feeling this club exudes. (It would be real nice with my love-y!) To top it all, extend that feeling stepping out onto the breathtaking spectacular view from the patio eye-ing the Las Vegas "Strip" as far as your eyes can see and see planes through your own "bird's eye" view of the McCarran International Airport. Hey, the plane, the plane! ...oh, planes! It's not the best view (it's the second best view as seen in the South part of Vegas) but Oh, but when the wind blows my hair in the way I like feeling it, it's just fine .. Feel like on top of the world! You, too.

This is one of my favorite views of Vegas. A bit over priced, but sometimes you gotta pay for the environment.   There is an indoor environment that's very voodoo and the outdoor deck is a fun spot to hang year round. In the winter they have space heaters to help keep you warm.   Definitely recommend this place!
Gorgeous view and great decor inside. Definitely stop there for at least one drink while in Vegas!

We had perhaps one of our best dinners here with my wife. Steak for me and chicken for her west awesome!! The wine was good and the waiters were very kind and hospitable. From the door man, to the bus boy-we were treated great. Its an expensive dinner-people here who complain about the price, what were they expecting? Its not sizzler! Anyhow, definitely has the best view of the whole strip! The lounge was good too-we just had a great time and will definitely go back.

I was really excited when a group of friends and I were able to get on the list to get into the Foundation Room on a Saturday night.  While a couple of friends and I (both guys and girls) were waiting for the rest of our group in the Mandalay Bay casino we were given free passes for admission to the Foundation Room. I should have known there that they were desperate to get people in the door. My friends and I used the free passes to go up to the Foundation Room and wait for the rest of our party there.    I read some reviews before going, so I expected an older, more laid back crowd which was fine by me. What I didn't expect was to see people in flip flops and jean shorts. I understand not having a strict dress code, but at least have some. Yes, the view is really nice of the strip and the decor is pretty cool inside. It is a decent place to go to have a drink, in an intimate setting. In the end, I guess I was just put off by how "exclusive" it was touted then to see a whole bunch of people there in beach wear who got free passes.

Hands down the best meal I had in years. Ok I might have been stoned and drunk but it's Vegas! We had 9 dudes each one of us got a separate main course some of us shared huge steaks. I shared a 16oz ribeye but we ended up taking small sample bites from each course limb a bunch of different steaks NY tomahawk steak lamb pork belly wrap in bacon (must have) really it melts in your mouth! We got basically got all the sides but asparagus just cause no one like it but I think I would anything this place has to offer! Everything you would normally hate would taste good here unless it could kill u. U probably won't like it. And how did this place get 3 $$$ that's totally false our bill was close to $1000 so you should it here if you have some disposable income to throw around!

what a strange place.. that doesnt seem to ever get more that moderately busy.. the patio is the place to be.. awesome view, great seating... inside its insanely dark.. like "bad strip club dark".. i saw vip spaces roped off and just wondered (with it practically empty inside)(the patio was full though).. why anyone would pay extra for a vip 'couch'..

We had such a fantastic time at the foundation room our last night in Las Vegas! The rooftop is beautiful and is the perfect view to see the lights of the entire strip. The DJ was playing a fun and eclectic mix of songs to dance to. The only downside is there did not seem to be a dress code that evening so you had the full gamut of people wearing Las Vegas nightclub attire to people wearing shorts and flip-flops. It was also nice that ladies got in for free and two free drinks. Definitely a place to check out while in Vegas!

The food is completely delicious although I don't think many places in hotels on the strip will be bad, especially with these prices.  The drinks are top notch, again I don't think you'll find anything of a lesser equal but what this place does have is service or at least that's what I found during my visit here.  The bar tenders took care of me and even though it was a packed night, I never waited long for my or my parties drinks.  The view is nothing short of unique with the entire first half of the strip in the distance which makes a perfect social media post.  It can get super crowded on that balcony though.  I would suggest going to the other side of the balcony where the restaurant is.

Why was i excited to go to the foundation room? 1) used to be members only- maybe the once "exclusiveness" sounded intriguing (maybe this should have been a warning flag) 2) LOVE the view at Mix and thought this might be another great one 3) received wrist bands from a guy at Mandalay Bay that gave Ladies hosted bar from 10pm-12am and were told ladies were free and guys were "reduced" admission for a steal at $20.   It was only 9:30 so the husband and I walked around and dropped some cash in the casino. We made our way over to the entrance around 10:30- no line, just a few guys that worked there. We walked up to the dude working there and I inquired about the hosted bar. He says "we aren't doing that". So I ask why they would give me a wristband that clearly says Ladies hosted bar from 10pm-12am and he repeats "we aren't doing that". So I ask if we can just both get in for free since this is clearly a bait and switch situation. He looks at me like he does not know what that phrase means. The husband says something "polite" and we leave.   Bottom line- I am rating the door experience only since I refused to pay for a hustle like that and you can get a great view and great service at Mix. You can also get a great view of the strip from the Voodoo Lounge. There are way too many great places and views in Vegas to deal with crap like that.  I love many of the restaurants and bars at Mandalay but this one sorely misses the mark. We will be dropping our alcohol money elsewhere!
The view from the balcony is probably the best in Vegas but the prices are outrageous and the drinks were mediocre. Very cool atmosphere though.

Great Service and one of the best atmosphere's to dine in Vegas which is saying a lot. Might be a bit overpriced for the food, but again, you pay extra for the views and surroundings.  Go for the Bourbon and Creme with Cookies for Dessert. You wont be disappointed. Skip the Truffle Mac, there is better, and go for the Twice Baked Potatoes for sides.

Celebrated my birthday Friday the 10 th. Had an absolute wonderful time enjoyed vip table and bottle service.  All the staff was amazing especially our server Amanda Mu Moo, Tyshaun our security and Nina!  Thanks for a wonderful evening!

So the view here is just WOW.  Totally the best part of the club.  I came here on business w/ a bunch of clients who took us out for the night.  We had a private room reserved and all the alcohol we wanted to drink.  The best part was passing up the line and having to wait about 0.5 seconds to get in.  I also LOVED how they let my co-worker in who had a pair of Chuck Taylors on.  And you know how Vegas clubs are..... no nice shoes = no entry.  Drinks were good since we had table service, so no complaints from me.  The decor was one of a kind.  I've never been to a club before that looked like this.  I kinda felt like I was in some kind of palace, and for a second failed to realize that we were in a club, lol.  The DJ was spinning some good danceable songs, but kinda switched it up too quick.  I saw some cuties here and there, and loved how some people danced even though there wasn't really a dance floor.  It never got too crowded and people were genuinely nice the entire night.  And oh, our waitress was mad foine and said she'd drink w/ me but never did.  Her loss.  LOL  Overall one of my favorite clubs in Vegas.  I'm glad I came here and would definitely come back another day.

I may be a bit biased since my husband is a member, so we get a bit of the special treatment, but I am a fan of this place for a few reasons.  Allow me to list them:  1.) Atmosphere: probably my most favorite thing.  The crowd is usually of an older age (30s - 50s) so it's not one of those BOOM BOOM clubs with 21 year olds going crazy and tripping off of something.  It's very classy and lounge-y here.  Around 10 PM, it becomes more of the nightclub environment and they take some of the bar stools away and some performers come out with shimmery, gold costumes.  The performers do choreographed dances, come out on stilts, and wear some weird 12-inch long fingernails which gives a burlesque type of feel.  2.) The View:  You are up on the 64th floor at the end of the Strip.  You can see down the entire length of Las Vegas Blvd.  Definitely a show stopper and a must see when visitors come to town.  It will make you look super cool to out-of-towners.  3.) The Service:  We've had the luxury of getting bottle service a few times, and the service from the door, to the host, to the bouncers has been top notch.  There is one bouncer in particular who I like the most.  I don't know his name, but he is hard to miss: a very tall, muscular, bald, Black man.  I once got caught in the crowd on my way back from the bathroom.  This gentleman saw me trying to squeeze through the crowd, took my hand, and personally led me through all the people back to our table.  On New Year's Eve, our host Wade went above and beyond to treat us well.  He walked us out onto the patio to a VIP area to watch the fireworks away from the crowd.  4.) Membership Perks: If you are a member, they have special events a couple times a month.  They are really cool.  Once they had a Kid's Night In and you got to bring kids up to the dining area where they had face painting, caricaturists, and balloon animals along with "kid food" like hot dogs and sliders and a s'mores station.  How often can you say you brought a kid to 'da club?
By far best rooftop bar view straight down the strip. A little tight quarters and pretty loud inside, and VERY expensive drinks...but you knew that going in.

So I was in Vegas for a convention at the end of last month, finding stuff to do after work was no problemo, like, Clark County baby!  One of the only things I actually planned from home was a visit to the Foundation Room. I actually spent some of MyVegas rewards to get free entry for me and me Mam, and it was friggin stellar.   The elevator is probably the smoothest in the world. 62nd floor I think? The ornate decor kind of envelops you from the get.   Bartendresses were very sweet; I--naturally--did champagne, parental unit had a fresh raspberry martini that smelled heavenly, the berries popped so much it was almost palpable.  The view? Made you realize how stunning life can be. On top of the world. Go at night. Take pictures that make your friends jealous. Breathe deep and thank the lord for another glorious day!

My favorite spot of the whole trip, and completely unexpected. A group of us made a reservation for dinner up here and I didn't know what was coming. We were waiting for the whole group and checked out the view - wowsa. Probably my favorite view of the whole town. Great angle because of where it is on the strip and how high this place is. Just absolutely gorgeous, ahh.  Dinner is on the other side of the floor, so we made our way over through the smell of incense into a dark room made light with the huge windows. Very quiet, very relaxed. We ordered a ton of food, meats and cheeses and such for appetizers and then wonderful different foods for the main course. Huge dishes of sides like mac and mushrooms to share. Beautiful dessert. Wow. I have to raise my glass for the steak though. Ordered it rare and it was probably the most perfect steak I've ever had. I could eat that every single day of my life.  There's a lot of expensive places to eat in Vegas. Make it count and come here, no regrets. No idea what they mean by members only since none of us were members of anything, but I guess you just have to be willing to come in a group and pay. Totally worth it.

This is one of the bright spots of my recent trip to Las Vegas.  Hidden well inside Mandalay Bay, this place is definitely a cool kick-it spot with a fantastic view.    We went there on a Thursday night and got great table service for our party.  Our lovely waitress was always around making sure our drinks are filled to the top and she is definitely a sight for sore eyes!  There were a few go-go dancers working their magic around the main room and they too are easy on the eyes.  Love the vibe...definitely very laid back.  Definitely tipped my cap off to the DJ playing his set.  The music selection was awesome!  Mix of current hip-hop and stuff from the 80's and 90's.  Wow...it was like going down memory lane when Easy E, Dr. Dre and Ice Cube came blaring through the speakers.  Now comes the kicker.....the magnificent view from their outside balcony.  All I can say is....it's breathtaking and it's a great perspective of how life should be!  Have fun....keep your head up...and keep your friends around you close.
Cool lounge and best view on the Strip!

Line up to get in the casino lobby for this. It's worth it! A bouncer takes your cover fee (if there is one) and checks your ID, before ushering you into an elevator to the top floor. There you find a club with a bar and a dj. The real draw is the balconey. It is shocking to find yourself eye to eye with the Mandalay Bay sign. It really sparkles! One of the benefits of being at the far end of the strip is that you can get a full view of the entire strip. It's stunning. The downside is that the balconey is a little small so it gets really crowded and full of smokers. It's still worth it for the view.
Love this place. The balcony has a great view of the Strip.

The Foundation Room exceeded all of our expectations. We made reservations for dinner for four ladies and were surprised when we were seated in our very own private dining room with incredible views for miles (the restaurant is located on the 63rd floor at Mandalay Bay). Our server, Leah, was attentive and made great suggestions. We had the seared scallops, bone in ribeye, and truffle Mac and cheese. Each dish was deliciously prepared and presented. Leah informed us that James, our host that evening, put us into the private dining room. James and a nice female manager (forgot her name) also helped us with a small issue we experienced with one of the bouncers. Overall, both James and Leah made our evening memorable and I would suggest the Foundation Room for foodies and those that love to dance the night away to old school hip hop and R & B. We will definitely be returning on our next trip.

Latest experience was terrible!  Came here to celebrate one of my buddy's birthday with a group of 8. The whole dinner was just terrible. First the hostess had trouble with our reservation and accidentally canceled our reservation. After that's worked out, we got our table. We were ignored for a long time, no menus or drink order anything. It took 10 minutes just to get the menus, then we asked for the restaurant week menu and first they couldn't find it and told us that it was not going on anymore, so I had to walk up to the front and ask a manager about it and then they were able to find The menu behind the hostess podium. Just seemed very disorganized.  Then it took another 15 minutes to take our drink orders and we were again ignored for 20 to 30 minutes after our drink orders were filled for us to wait to order food. After food was ordered we got our appetizers in 20min, then waited an hour before we got our entrees. Dessert then took another 30min and we kept asking our waiter about it and he would tell us 5 min and nothing would happen. Throughout the meal, our drinks were not filled, asked for extra napkins several times, and asked about our food order and was ignored. The 2 people serving our table was impatient, not attentive at all, and when they did come they had an annoyed attitude and did not meet most of our requests! For the caliber of this restaurant, the service is absolutely unacceptable!! Our dinner took 3.5 hours!!!! Insane!!  Not returning EVER!

I had a great time having dinner here.  It is little bit pricey, but the ambience was worth it. The food was okay, and the taste was elevated by the ambience.  After the dinner, go to the patio, and have a seat at the sofa and enjoy the view.

We've been a member of the Foundation Room for years, but you don't have to be a member to dine here ~ anymore. Although we live in Dallas, we've probably frequented the one in LV more than we have the Dallas location.  This is a wonderful place to dine, and it's uncanny how they are always on the cutting edge of food one might not find elsewhere. From Christine at the host stand - - to the servers - - to the management, everyone is so professional, accommodating, and affable.  Jacob Kaufman is really a stellar operations manager; he is friendly, generous, classy, polished, smart, and VERY willing to make your experience memorable. The guys that took care of us, Alo and Shawn, were knowledgeable and flexible. I wanted my diver scallops prepared a a certain way. Not only did they accommodate us, the preparation was over the top!  We LOVE being a member of the Foundation Room! As an aside, this is absolutely (in our opinion) THE best view in Vegas!!

Attended a lovely dinner party here the weekend before last. Hands-down, the best service I have ever experienced here in The Valley. I have lived, partied, wined and dined here for over a decade. The staff at Foundation Room understands service in the most natural way. There's no inauthentic ass-kissing just plain and simple good  service in a relaxed, attentive atmosphere. The meal was excellent, the fillet was perfection and the prawns were a-ok. In addition to the best view in the city, Foundation offers a mature atmosphere for 30 somethings looking for a night-out with others who can handle their liquor and want to enjoy themselves.

I haven't really enjoyed the club scene much in the last couple years but The Foundation Room changed all that for me this past Friday. The music was a good mix to keep the diverse crowd happy and on the floor, the drinks were great and my bartender Brian was friendly and on top of his job.

I really liked the feel of this place.  Hubby and I were invited up so hey we weren't going to turn down seeing one of the best views in Vegas.  We were let in through the velvet ropes and took the private elevator to the top floor (66 or 67 floors....can't remember).  There is a restaurant but we were just there for drinks.  I would like to go back sometime as I am sure the dinner views are gorgeous.  The decor is very dark and comfortable...it looks like what I imagine the English men's clubs must have looked like in days of old.  Big comfy couches and chairs and a gorgeous wooden bar.  It is the kind of place you can have long conversations with your date or a great time with friends.  It was freezing outside on their deck to see the view and then we came back in.  BUT what a view! We will definitely come back when the weather is warm and sit and just soak in the view of the strip.  The only thing I did not like was our server.  It was not that she wasn't nice because she was, it was her behavior.  First the servers wear what look like lingerie with stockings.  This does not bother me...it is Vegas.  However our server was spilling out of the top of her outfit, I mean god bless her if she sneezes because everyone is getting a free show.  Anyway even that didn't bother me as much as it felt kind of awkward sitting there pretending not to notice the girls...and then she sat down beside my hubby touched his arm and asked for our order.  I am no prude but it just made me feel AWKWARD. So we were one drink and out.    On the whole it is a hip place to hang out and we will definitely be going back.  The drinks were good and the service fast and nice (And you may even get a free show ;)
Love the view its not filled to the max with people and room to move around.  GREAT SPOT FOR VIEWS. They have a membership but you can get in several different ways.

First, I would like to start off this comment by stating that I only post on Yelp if it's really good, or REALLY bad. This, my friends, is unfortunately the latter.  The short version of my post: Foundation Room tried to play us for fools and ruined our dining experience.  The long version: (which I hope you'll read because it's quite ridiculous)  To start things off, my girlfriends and I ordered a bottle of Pinot Noir. Nothing fancy, just a $50 bottle that we were already planning to order more of (get Vegas started off right, right?!) So we order the first bottle and this is where the fun begins...  Instead of bringing out the bottle and doing the normal wine presentation that you're used to seeing at a restaurant, she brings out a tray with four pre-filled glasses that each look as though they have one shot of wine in each glass. She sets them down in front of us and leaves. My friends and I (who are no strangers to wine) just stare at each other in disbelief. She calls this a glass of wine? Where is the rest? There was maybe three sips in each. Maybe. Now, I know we didn't order their top notch bottle and I didn't expect their in-house sommelier to pour it, but I did expect to at least see the bottle and I did expect to at least receive the entire contents of the bottle that we were paying for and not just a portion of it. Everyone at the table knew instantly that there was no way we were poured an entire bottle of wine (unless, of course, it was the World's smallest bottle of wine.)  Now, since we had no proof that she didn't pour us the entire bottle (since she never brought it out to us and it was pre-poured in back) we ordered another bottle for our husbands and asked for new glasses. We also asked her for the bottle to be brought to the table(uncorked) and a presentation. Our waitress obliged. She came out with the new bottle, corked it before us and filled up the new glasses in the exact amount she did with the first four original wine glasses. And guess what, surprise surprise, after pouring the contents in equal amounts as the first round, there was still HALF A BOTTLE left remaining on the table. So our little experiment worked and proved that she did in fact completely scam us on the first bottle ordered--by filling our glasses in the back of the house and trying to pass it off as a full bottle.  We were obviously bummed this was happening, especially given the reputation of the restaurant, so in order to remedy the situation and not cause a scene, one of my girlfriends pulled the waitress aside in the hallway and told her we knew what had happened and that we just wanted things made right. The waitress completely agreed, apologized for the situation and told my friend she'd make sure it was taken care of.   Foundation Rooms remedy: Two complimentary desserts (which we didn't order) and instead of charging us for a full bottle for the first bottle, they charged us for four individual glasses of wine instead.   Now, why do people order bottles of wine instead of individual glasses of wine at restaurants? Because it's cheaper and you get more, right? So aside from the desserts we didn't want, their solution was to actually charge us MORE for the wine than what we had originally asked for. My blood pressure was through the roof at this point. The dessert was a nice gesture, but we didn't ask for it. I was completely fine paying full amount for the second bottle since we actually were able to enjoy it fully BUT BY GOD I wasn't paying anything towards something we didn't order, weren't able to enjoy and were just outright cheated on.  I gestured the waitress over, pointed to the four glasses of wine by the glass listed on the receipt and simply told her "Mam, we did not order four glasses of wine, we ordered a bottle of wine. Since you and I both know we did not receive a bottle of wine, I would like these glasses of wine we didn't order removed."   Our waitress nodded, and without hesitation, FINALLY fixed the situation.  We travel to Vegas three-four times a year and needless to say, I do not recommend The Foundation Room and will not be returning.   I hope you find this review helpful and that Foundation Room improves their manner and poor service.

The Foundation Room Restaurant is for members only on most nights, however, the food, service and views is worth every penny. Truly, this place holds one of the very best views in all of Las Vegas.  The Foundation Room is highly recommended.
Nice view, OK crowd (could be better). Only upside is I got in for free.

My wife and I are members for the second year in a row.  Before joining, we would buy VIP passes for certain show that gained us access into the FR.  We love the place.  We joined at the first opportunity.  Like any private club, the more often you go the better the staff learns your preferences.  Sadly, we can only make it there a couple of times per month but the staff remembers our names and our drinks.    It is the premier place to see a concert/show in Cleveland.  Close and intimate.  Sometimes, the entertainer comes to the FR after the show.   The food is 5 star.   The atmosphere is eclectic.  The service is top notch.  There is a private entrance to concert venue from the FR which affords the ability to come and go during a show for no wait drinks.  Clean, private bathrooms.  Free coat check and more.  In the summer, there is a patio on the top of the HOBs that overlooks 4th Street for perfect people watching and a great view of downtown Cleveland.  Absolutely go if you get a chance.  Join if you can.  A great value and a fun time, every time.
We try to go here every time were in Vegas. Gorgeous decor and view down the strip. The service and food are both amazing.

We got free entry into this place and decided to have our pre-dinner drink here, since we were staying at Mandalay Bay anyway. It was a little early in the evening and the place was dead. We were supposed to get a free drink, but the bartender said that there was something wrong with the little cards we'd been given. When we saw the view from the balcony we decided to get a drink anyway. The view is spectacular. You can see the entire strip and a beautiful mountain-scape. It was totally worth the $7 I paid for a Coors Light.   I would check this place out if you're nearby and don't have to pay cover, but I wouldn't make a special trip or pay to get in.

I really expected it to be a better experience. But it was the worst. We went for my son's 21st birthday. I called to ask if we could bring a birthday cake and they said yes. When we arrived we were told that there was an $8 fee per slice. Nice! There were 6 of us and the bill was over $600. I had the lamb. Very disappointed. Barely warm and no flavor. I do it way better at home. No one ever came over to see how everything was. Not worth what they charge. Go to Del Friscos. That's a real restaurant.

Zero stars for this place and extremely disappointed and disgusted by them. Came for happy hour. The hostess said they are doing a special fundraiser to help people who have cancer with financial burdens. We told her my uncle who was with us has cancer currently, so it was good to see them fundraising. The security then said my uncle could not go in because males must have close toed shoes. My mom, aunt, and I have flip flops on. My uncle has woven sandals where barely any of his feet are showing the his toes are completely covered. What a disappointment and extremely upsetting.

Our reservation was for 7:00 and we had spent an hour on the bar side prior to heading over to the restaurant. We were told our table wasn't ready and to go hang out in the bar. I said we were just in the bar. I asked how long, she said she didn't know, they were over booked.  We finally sat down at 7:35. But the Manager came right over and apologized and said to order 4 appetizers on the house which was cool since there were 6 of us.  Apps and dinner were awesome! Highly recommend the mushroom risotto, crab cakes and the grouper. Once we got seated it was a great night!

I got really lucky on Friday night.  I was with 2 male friends, and they had asked if we could go to a club.  I told them most places would charge us a hefty cover, and we'd have to wait in a big line.  Walking into the Mandalay Bay, we were headed for a bar and got intercepted by a host.  He offered us some 2-for-1 drink passes at Foundation Room.  When I inquired about cover, he hemmed and hawed and eventually said he could walk us in.  It was a few moments of confusion at the door, as I don't think he was supposed to walk in 3 guys, but it worked!  We made it up to the bar with minutes before 10pm, when the 2-for-1's stopped working, and we got a round of drinks.  $18 for 2 rum & cokes and 2 beers.  OK prices, but we wouldn't be sticking around for a full priced round.  I've been there before but they hadn't . Obviously the view is amazing, though I prefer the view from Moon at the Palms better as you get to see the whole strip.  Clientele was mostly older guys and their girlfriends/wives, but there were a few single people there as well.  Great vibe in the place.  Wish we would have gone back later in the night since had our hands stamped.

A group of five girls visited Las Vegas for a birthday party. Our best night was at the Foundation Room at the Mandalay Bay. Dennis DaSilva, Executive Host at the FR could not have been nicer!!  Wade Takamoto went above and beyond as well. So wonderful and accommodating to my entire party. The entire staff treated us like we were the most important people in town. Ask for these guys if you go.  My husband and I are Foundation Room Members out of New Orleans. We always ensure to go to the FR if available in every city. All are great but Vegas was such a treat!!  A must go with the best view on the entire strip.

The food was amazing! Everything was cooked to perfection and all of our meals were top notch! The Lamb Shank was the best! Although it's a very big serving, it was tasty. Our service was just ok. We were seated right away but once at the table waited 15 min for someone to come and greet us. They apologized and said they didn't know what happened. The views are breathtaking!

Per my review of Mandalay Bay:  A must, should you have the opportunity, is the Foundation Room.  The food - mmmm...my event was completely catered with incredible delicacies from Asian delectables, ribs, shrimp, and more to a the most lavish spread of goodies waiting to be dunked in the towering chocolate fountain.  Then there is the view......that's all that needs to be said...the view.  Comfortable nooks and rooms of historical enchantment suck you in and forbid you to leave.    It's totally chill and relaxed...hope you have great experience as well.
The food was average.  Fish was over cooked. Service was very poor as they never checked to see how the food was.  And they charged  our credit card so many times that  it got frozen

Decent service and really good decor. Where this bar shines is the view- it's fantastic!  The bar was crowded, but didn't feel sleepy like some clubs can. Worth a trip for a drink and picture at the top, with some Vegas opulence mixed in.

Great place, with a great view, and quite possibly one of my new favorite places.  I visited this place a while back and never wrote a review for it, but since I just visited this place last weekend I thought I'd write a review(this time).  My friends and I were at the Nightclub and Bar Convention and one of the perks for badgeholders of the convention was a club pass for various clubs across town, which included the Foundation Room.  Upon entering the place, we went up and started drinking, and having a good time.  Took a bunch of good pictures in the balcony area.  I can't say how much the drinks costs, because I can't really remember how much it was or if it was free.    It's a great place to take friends to hangout, have some drinks and have a good time!!!!!!
